Reviews.Title: “THIS IS HORRIBLE!! LIKE A HOSTEL FROM THE MOVEIS!”
Reviews.Author: Shyla Rochelle B
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel that i have ever stayed in my life! It was so bad that we booked the rest of our vacation at another hotel and didnt even care if we missed out on money! First of all when we got there at 3 to check in we were told our room WASNT available!! And we didnt get in a room until 7! We were never offered any money back or anything! It made us late for our Broadway show! Then when we got back to the hotel that night we discovered how digusting the room was! There was black human hair ALL over the bedspreads! Their was garbage in the bathroom and the shower curtain would NOT stay closed! So when we showered the floor got soaked!! They also told us they didnt have anymore towels when we asked so we had 2 towels for 3 girls! The room was freezing! When we went down to ask for blanklets they said they didnt have any and offered a space heather...seriously!? a space heater!? Their was one window in the room with NO curtains!! You could see right out and anyone could see right in! And worst of all their was a room right by the bathroom and it had a broken bed in it and it was piled with about 15 bags of trash! Thats is not even close to sanitary!! How are they not embarrassed to let someone rent that room!!!??? We ended up getting a much more wonderful hotel the next morning for only an additional 50 a night. Well worth it! I do not recommend this place. OH! And the hotel is the smallest elevator in the history of elevators! All three of us girls could BARELY fit in there!!! HORRIBLE HOTEL! How is it in buisness still!?!?!?!?!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: This is probably the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The rooms are appaling air con stuck to the window with tape, broken light bulbs rock band playing next door and the final indignity a drunk passed out on the step outside. Really poor and best avoided

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a short trip.”
Reviews.Author: PirateChar
Reviews.Content: My partner and I used this hotel back in March 2011 (I had to put April 2011 as it didn't go back as far as March!) for a weekend trip for our 1 year anniversary. When we initially booked the hotel we were quite worried and didn't really know what to expect after reading previous reviews on here. The night we arrived in New York our family wanted us to call home to make sure we had landed safe, after a while trying to use the pay phone in reception we gave up as it just kept rejecting our calls. We informed the guy at reception and he told us to return to our room and he'd sort it out so we could use the phone in our room to call home. True to his word he did and we quickly made a call, after returning to reception to say thank you and pay him he told us not to worry which we thought was really nice considering we were calling back to the UK. They also allowed us to do this the day we were leaving. As for our room when we booked the holiday we booked for a room with a double bed and to our surprise when we opened the door we had 2! The room itself was fairly small with a rail on the wall for hanging clothes and a small TV facing the bed. The bathroom again was small with a bath/shower, toilet and sink but overall for the time you spend in your room and what you use the room for it was excellent. The hotel is situated in a good walking distance from everything. The staff are very friendly (Especially helping us out when we needed a first aid box) and the hotel is perfect if all you want is somewhere to sleep, wash and drop shopping off through your day. I would definitely book here again if I was going to return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: MrsSEngland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was within minutes of Time Square, helpful staff and clean warm room. We booked a double room for my daughter and I, but they gave us a room with 2 double beds when we arrived. If you want a plush hotel then don't stay here but if you want a great location in a clean and friendly budget hotel then I would highly recommend this one. We would definitely sty here again.

Reviews.Title: “Steps from Times Square”
Reviews.Author: HungryBay
Reviews.Content: Good hotel if you're looking to be plugged into the Times Square scene. Crowded at reception at our visit due to airline attendants checking in at same time. Not much for lounge/lobby meeting space like other large hotels. Decent stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property”
Reviews.Author: LivinTheDream48
Reviews.Content: An excellent property, located in the heart of Times Square. Convenient to theaters, restaurants, Madison Square Garden, Penn Station, and Macy's. Friendly staff, modern rooms, and part of the Starwood loyalty program. Willie Tongo was especially helpful in resolving a reservation snafu (that I created).

Reviews.Title: “It was a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: Marcos S
Reviews.Content: It was a bargain to stay at the Manhattan Broadway Hotel. Staff was great, rooms clean, great shower, but like everyone said it was all about LOCATION!! LOCATION!!! LOCATION!!! Marcos Shibuta

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location !!”
Reviews.Author: luv2vacaDenverCo
Reviews.Content: its not the Westin ....But it IS very clean, and budget friendly...we booked the suite in 209 for a family of 5. The room included 2 queen beds one twin captain bed with a pull out twin bed underneath and a small convertible twin sofa bed, fridge and microwave. 2 blocks from Times Square and Penn Station. Easy acces to taxi ,subway and bus. if u decide to stay u have to try 2 Bros pizza (Don't even bother with Roll and go pizza !)....will stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, GREAT LOCATION, A MUST STAY!”
Reviews.Author: estelle e
Reviews.Content: A must stay. A close two block walk to time square. Comfortable clean beds. Close to the subway. the concierge were very helpful. This property was close to all amenities. next time i travel to NYC i will stay here again. Also, it was close to central park as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and nice price”
Reviews.Author: djCooperp
Reviews.Content: It is at good location near time square and close to subway. Price is also a good deal. Room is also clean. If I go to NY next time, i will choose to stay at Manhattan Broadway Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfying Stay”
Reviews.Author: Azyad
Reviews.Content: The service that my sister and I had from the hotel staffs was great. We felt really welcomed! Strategic location, easy to get to Times square, new york public library and the eateries around :)

Reviews.Title: “perfect choice for a low budget city trip”
Reviews.Author: Claudia E
Reviews.Content: In the beginning I decided for this hotel because of its great location and its prices. The rooms are simple but clean! i went there for christmas shopping so the location was absolutely great!! Time Square just 3 blocks away and Broadway only 2 blocks! I stayed for 3 nigths and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “It's been lovely”
Reviews.Author: navidad11
Reviews.Content: You have a great service and wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “good price”
Reviews.Author: mariab88
Reviews.Content: Is a good hotel, very clean and is good located.. The service is excelent

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location - Old and Tired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DEWDENVER
Reviews.Content: This location is terrific, just 3 blocks off of Times Square. Easy to get everywhere. Hallways and rooms are a bit dingy. Lobby is just computers but no printer. Walls are thin and heard other guests constantly. Lots of kids and bus tour types. Pool was really nice for being in the city. Fitness cramped but machines adequate. Stayed 3 nights and would go back - with ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ruthiesteve
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a budget hotel with a great location I would recommend this hotel. It would be wrong to say that it isn't in need of a refurbishment, however the room was clean and the beds were comfy with clean sheets. We had a power shower and clean bathroom. There was no light from the windows but as we only used the room as a base for sleeping this was not a problem. Please ignore the negative reviews as they are unfounded. If you are looking for a luxury hotel then don't stay here, if you would rather save your money for shopping and sight seeing then this is a great place to stay, Staff are friendly and really helpful. Wi-fi was an added bonus and only cost $3 a day. We stayed for 3 nights and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you're not picky”
Reviews.Author: WSJ1981
Reviews.Content: I normally stay in luxury hotels when I travel, but my trip last weekend to NYC was last-minute and I was unable to get a petsitter for my golden retriever. This hotel is convenient to Times Square, is pet-friendly, and REASONABLY clean. $200 will get you a three- or four-star hotel in most American cities, but if you want to stay near Times Square without having to take out a second mortgage on your home or selling your firstborn, your options are very limited. The room is small, the beds are tolerable-at-best, and the halls occasionally reek of the smell of marijuana smoke, but this hotel is still better than others in the area at a similar price point. The staff was very courteous and attentive (by New York standards). If your are a business traveler who values location over anything else or tourists who aren't picky, this hotel is a great choice. It isn't the sort of place I'd bring children or a pretentious mother-in-law, however. If you're expecting luxury in the NYC area for under $300, you'd probably be better off staying in New Jersey or Connecticut and taking the train into town.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, nice people”
Reviews.Author: Zheng T
Reviews.Content: Its location is perfect, about 5 or 6 minutes walking to Time Square and Penn Station. After landing in JFK, I took Long Island Rail Road to Penn Station, and very easily got to the hotel. People here are very nice and helpful. I'll thank the manager for help upgrading to a two-bed room for my mother and me without a charge. Although the room is tiny, it's clean, warm and quiet. It's definitely a very good choice to go.

Reviews.Title: “It was excellent for us!”
Reviews.Author: Pedro O
Reviews.Content: Truly very basic, but it was perfect for us. If you have stayed in a typical European hotel, you will not be surprised by the small size of the elevator, narrow hallways and small rooms. However, you can't beat the price and location. Staff were friendly. We stayed in a 3-person room (one single and a bunk-bed) in the top (4th) floor. We did not experience any noise issues from either the lower floors or any other rooms, and the hotel was full. We did hear the street noise because our room faced the street. But we did not mind because we are city people and are used to it. Short walks to subway, Times Square, Broadway shows, Madison Square Garden. Our room and bathroom were clean. Another advantage versus bigger hotels was the fact that there were no lines for check-in/out. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth P
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was not as pictured. I would not even give this place one star. The bathroom was moldy and TINY. The room was TINY. You could hear every door open and close. There is no heat, only a small space heater sitting in the corner. There was a woman yelling in the hallway in a foreign language . Very loud music for long periods of time. It is the worst hotel I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Believe it !!!”
Reviews.Author: Patrick and Mer... C
Reviews.Content: Believe the reviews !!!! Staff was friendly, location good. BUT windows are painted shut, black mold in the bathroom and the rooms are on top of a music studio that is open all night. LOUD LOUD LOUD. Next time I'll stay in Newark and come into the city on the train.

Reviews.Title: “Good with points of improvement”
Reviews.Author: Balbq
Reviews.Content: The hotel service is excellent! Susie is a very nice person, and dedicated customers, have to admit! And the other staff were also committed to help with any questions or problems. Another great thing was the location point: very good! 3-4 blocks from Times Square! Close to everything! I did most things on foot. Now, points of improvement: cleaning the rooms. They were always dirty because the hotel never cleaned the floor. It had a lot of dirt, and hair from previous guests. The bed linen could also improve as comforters were old and very used. I found them too many hairs from other guests. We could pass a reform, it has many good things to offer. Overall I enjoyed staying there. It was a hotel used only to sleep. In short: excellent location, very friendly attendants and willing to help. But the room cleaning, linen, and conservation of the hotel were not good. If you are looking for a hotel with great location, just to sleep and with proper care, can stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But What a Dump......”
Reviews.Author: Stephen B
Reviews.Content: Great location The beds are old and worn out. The shower curtain molded and smelled bad. It's loud, people in the hallway talking smoking dope. To bad this location could be really nice but they have not kept up this place. The price was good. But if I where to do it all over again I would have spent the extra money and stayed somewhere cleaner and nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff & basic room in good location”
Reviews.Author: Shimeka
Reviews.Content: Small room but ok if you're not spending much time there. Sheets weren't clean so ended up sleeping on top of the duvet & covering with our towels! Talking of towels... The cleaner took my towel! Not entirely sure how that happened as their towels are white & beige... Mine was blue! Location is good, about 10 mins walk to Times Sq... Right in the fashion district. I've noticed reviews about the noise... The air con is loud, the ice machine in the hallway is louder & did wake us up in the early hours - but who really sleeps in NYC anyway..?! For a short, basic stay I would definitely stay here again. It was 'fine'.

Reviews.Title: “Bed? Check. Shower? Check. Internet? Check.”
Reviews.Author: TravellinMuthaUcka
Reviews.Content: Here is the deal people. This hotel is very cheap, and it is in a stellar location for tourists and businesspeople alike. It is two blocks from Penn Station, and 3 blocks from Times Square. You can get anywhere in the city in under a half hour. If you're looking for the Ritz, it is actually a different hotel - this is the Manhattan Broadway - you see not only is it in Manhattan, it is very near Broadway. I didn't have any problems with the AC, but it wasn't too hot when I was there - so that could be a big deal if it is really hot. The folks at the front desk were nice, and internet was 10 dollars for 4 nights (can't beat that). The sheets didn't match each other, and the room was small, but I slept there, and did some work on the desk - and not only did my bed hold me up, the little desk held my computer too. The bed was cleaned daily, and my assortment of towels was a nice surprise every night. My shower actually had like 6 heads (they were plastic but still shot water out)! So bottom line - are you picky? Then stay the hell away. Is your wife or other companion picky? Stay the hell away. Are you someone who would rather spend your money on beer and pizza when in New York? This hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “nightmare”
Reviews.Author: elleyrose
Reviews.Content: this was the worst hotel i have ever been to in my whole life the beds were broken the place was small and very dirty . i would not even give it a rating paint coming off of the walls

Reviews.Title: “Room without a view”
Reviews.Author: trevor b
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Sunday afternoon. First noticed the Chinese restaurant next to the entrance with litter and rubbish outside. The lobby was small but the people on reception were friendly and helpful. Our room was on the 3rd floor. The room size was OK but a definate lack of wardrobe space. The room had one small window which couldnt be opened. Also the window had no view and faced directly onto a wall. There was no natural light whatsoever. The room was also vey hot, the cooling unit worked and but was very noisy, this had to be on all night to cool the room. The bathroom was clean but again the tiny window faced a wall. The hotel was in a good location and overall was OK to stay in for a few nights. It suited our purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in Manhatten”
Reviews.Author: Scott_Leslie
Reviews.Content: Terrible. Rooms have peeling paint, exposed wall wires, no desk and no closet. Shower basins had permanent mold stains. Same for all 3 rooms we had. DO NOT stay at this hotel even if their price seems enticing. It will ruin your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but room is yuk!”
Reviews.Author: Sameelin
Reviews.Content: The room that I stayed in had an odour, the air conditioning was broken, everything in it was old. The lifts are tiny and can barely fit 2 ppl. If your not planning on spending much time in your room then get it. The location is great (only 5-10 min walk to times square), the lady at the front desk was very resourceful and this was one of the cheapest hotels I could find when researching places to stay in NYC which was close to times square. I guess you get what u pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Small but serves its purpose perfectly. Pretty good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: mills282
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for from this hotel. It may not look the greatest from first impressions- the mini lobby, the small double room, and the tiny elevator -but for the money you are paying and in the location the hotel is in you can't really complain. Our room was clean and the location is great. NYC is easy enough to get around but when you're so close to Times Square, 5th Ave, and some of the other attractions its worth spending a few extra dollars a night to be in the centre of Manhattan. The service here was good too. The front desk staff were really friendly and looked after us. If you're looking for fancy décor and a big room then you need to look more upmarket, however if you need a cheap room with little thrills, that is secure and comfortable enough then this should suit you fine. In my opinion it was good value for money overall.

Reviews.Title: “location & price made this hotel worth it”
Reviews.Author: Angieb01
Reviews.Content: Went for a drum competition and needed a hotel within walking distance to Sam Ash. Even though i had several people warn me about this hotel, and many others; i decided to choose it for a 2 day trip into the city. It was located very close to times square, broadway and Rockefeller, so we were able to walk everywhere we needed to go. We had a small room with 2 double beds. literally a room with a bed at each wall with about 4 feet in between. small window unit AC (which they turned off twice while we were out of the room, which is my only complaint since it was hot out). The room was clean, the bed was actually very comfortable, and the bathroom was clean and water pressure and temp was great. We were on the 3rd floor and instead of using the small elevator, we were fine with taking the stairs. The ice machine was not working one day but the next it was up and running. The staff was very friendly and helpful and check in-out was very quick and painless. The chinese place next door (one on the right) had good food and they were also very friendly. i was surprised with how friendly everyone in the city was. alot of complaints about noise and loud music at night was unfounded. Only think i ever hear was the occasional siren from emergeny vehicles. We even had the window half open one night and i thought it was actually very quiet. if u need space and want more luxury or pampering or like to hang out in ure hotel room alot, i'd go with something else. if u want a decent hotel with the essentials u need that is really close to times square i would recommend this hotel. I would advise anyone with kids to try another hotel because of the small rooms and lack of extras like breakfast and such. otherwise, we liked it and had no issues besides having the AC turned off on us.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back next time.”
Reviews.Author: rebeccaying7
Reviews.Content: I took biz trips year round and visited NYC 2 times each year. It's my favorite hotel. very convenient to visit customers, go to restaurant and go shopping. And the most important point is that it's very clean though its price is cheaper than others around in this area. I will stay there next time. lol

Reviews.Title: “Greate value for low-end hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtime99
Reviews.Content: This hotel's official name is the Manhattan Broadway BUDGET Hotel. That makes them a rare honesty among Times Square hotels. Tucked away on 38th street you have a close walk to the Times Square action. The rooms are very small, even for NY standards. Despite being a budget hotel, at least the furniture is modern, the bead clean and the bathroom is actually 3-star quality. The bathroom featured and amazon double shower-head , one fixed and one mobile, with 6 extra sprinklers coming at you from the wall in front. I'd never experienced such a fancy shower all my life! Shows they at least try to make the best of things. Staff is friendly and helpful and showed me the way to the nearby post office and laundromat on 9th avenue. When I arrived, a girl was complaining that the hotel looked nothing like the pictures on the internet. I checked now and to my opinion the pictures are representative. This is a $100 dollar a night hotel room in the Times Square area. You should keep NY housing prices in mind and understand that you will get a very small room without any windows. If you are a classy girl, get a boyfriend with more money to go the Hilton, because this is just not your hotel. For people with budgets, this hotel is fine. Just spend your time outside the room.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: hello-Daniel
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights in this hotel with my wife visiting friends in NY. This hotel was just fine for us. The room was rather small but the bed was big and confortable; same with the bathroom, and everything looked reasonable clean. What I liked the most is the location next to 8th avenue; it is very close to times square but not overwellmed by the turists crouds, and 8 and 9th avenues have more authentic NY restaurants and bars and better prices that the times square area. My room was not facing the street and in was very quiet. I was recomended by the hotel staff (by phone) to park at the Central parking structure at 40th between 7 and 8th. !!!Be prepared to take all your luggage and things from the car as soon as you pull over, since they will park your car for you and you can not access it untill you take the car away!!!. They charged me $60 for 47 hours with a boucher I was given at the hotel desk. We had breakfast at a chinese bakery next to the hotel with real NY people. The coffee and the pastries were surprisingly good.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't recommend this place UNLESS you need somewhere to lay your head before you leave in the morning.”
Reviews.Author: ddm2008
Reviews.Content: March 2011, wide eyed and anxious about my first New York City audition, I booked the MBH as my residence for 2 days, 1 night. Boy was I shocked when I saw the place. Now I will say that the LOCATION is PERFECT, your right around the corner from Times Square. But the hotel is really crummy, raggedy, and has a crack house feel. I can honestly say that the staff was relatively nice. The plumbing was DUCK TAPED together, the tub in the bathroom had a stain as if someone had DIED in it. The room was really small and they CHARGE you to place your bags in a CLOSET, if your need to leave your bags before you check in. LOL. Luckily I knew people in the city and I wasn't in my room at all except to sleep. The price was relatively cheap so I guess you get what you pay for. I personally wouldn't recommend this hotel unless your just looking for a place to lay your head before you leave in the morning. I hope my review helps someone out, I believe that hotel should be SHUT DOWN by the HEALTH DEPARTMENT.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: Magglett
Reviews.Content: We were on a pretty strict budget when we decided to go to New York City for the first time. It was our 30th wedding anniversary and we wanted to try something we hadn't done before. This hotel was offered as part of a package we booked on line. If you're looking for a luxury hotel then this isn't it ... but ... if you're looking for a nice tiny clean central place to stay ... this could be for you. Our room was small but it had a Queen sized bed, fridge with freezer, microwave, and a tv. I've never seen such a tiny elevator, held the two of us and our suitcase but I doubt it would hold more. It's so close to everything, my hubby and I walked to all of the major attractions. The customer service was amazing, it's a tiny place so they remember you. They even helped us find an inexpensive replacement for our suitcase which the airport broke. Not easy to find inexpensive things in NYC. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cb159
Reviews.Content: OK, the staff are friendly, but the good points stop there. The hotel feels sleazy and is incredibly loud with band practice that goes on in the building across the road from about 10 O clock at night onwards, depending on what side of the hotel you are on you will either be deafened or just disturbed to a degree that you cannot sleep. The management are incapable of getting the music stopped. I did manage to move rooms in the middle of the night and was put in a room that stunk of foul cigarette smoke and was dirty. Horrible horrible experience for the truly desperate!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, with good price and location.”
Reviews.Author: magnata602
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. The room is small, but it is cozy! The location is perfect. You can walk to times square in a few minutes. There are many restaurants and stores near. The only thing that I didn't like was the internet. You have to pay to use it. The price is cheap in comparation with another hotels in same area. I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: NELLA870719
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this low-budget hotel for 3 nights and I enjoyed every moment of my trip! Check-in was at 3pm but a room was available at midday for 20$ as an early-check-in fee.. Which was great considering we arrived at 7am. The room was small, no closet space and smelled a little bit stuffy but as soon as we put on the a/c fan it cleared up quick. Front desk was friendly and very helpful. If you're travelling and have a lot of clothes to hang (like we did, 'cause were girlies) make sure you bring your own hangers because each room only supplies 2. I read some reviews before going so i brought my laptop, and my own towel and bath products. Bathroom was very clean. Minimal disturbances throughout the night, considering it was St, Patrick's day weekend and there was a lot of party people out. Double bed was comfortable. Small flat screen with cable hung in front of the bed. We received free internet :) complimentary of the nice Asian lady at the check-in counter. We checked out an hour later (for 10$ more). Deposit is 40$ cash/credit. Everything was fine. If you're used to going to Hilton-quality hotels, this is not the place you should go.. But if you're looking for a place to stay a couple of nights, with a fantastic location, this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Words can't describe but I'll try”
Reviews.Author: prod429
Reviews.Content: Pros: the location is good, the tv worked and I got a really cheap price booking through priceline Cons: everything else. We walk into the place and it's a small, dark hallway entrance. The staff was friendly enough but as we took the single tiny elevator to our room, we had to make two trips so we could fit in the elevator with our luggage. The room was about the size of a single-person freshman college dorm room only I know when I was in college, those dorm rooms were actually nicer and cleaner. The room was filthy. The phone looked like it had been thrown against the wall about 12 times but it worked. The beds were hard and sheets were dirty. The old A/C unit worked but was level with the beds so if you're stuck in that bed the A/C blows on you and you'll probably get sick too (or at least freeze all night). The bathroom was small and disgusting. We had to call down to the front desk to get an iron and ironing board as this wasn't in the room. There was no closet but a small rack on the wall to hang things. The place had one ice machine on the bottom floor so I guess that's better than none, but just something you expect. From seeing the place I wouldn't have been surprised at all if the police had raided one of the rooms to bust some degenerate. It seems like one of those places where you'd see them catch a scumbag on Law & Order. We kept our doors locked the entire time for fear of armed robbery. I'm sure the place rents these rooms by the hour to hookers. The only other positive I can think of is that after getting back from a night out, we didn't come back to find all of our possessions stolen. Of course, you wouldn't list that as a positive at a normal hotel you just expect it. This place is ideal for a homeless person that would like 4 walls and a roof over their heads. I could also see poor college kids on a budget cramming in here for an nyc weekend trip because in college you're generally used to living in filth. However, if you do stay here, be sure not to pay what some of these other morons paid. Get the room off of priceline so you at least save more money and be sure to bring a knife, pepper spray or a hand gun so you feel safer.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, awesome for the price”
Reviews.Author: EatRice112
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with a couple of friends last week. After reading all the reviews here we were rather skeptical. However, the overall experience turned out great. Although the furniture may be old and sometimes dusty, the place is decently clean overall. You also get urself a nice bathroom and very good service from the front desk. Overall, if you're on a budget, but wants a decent place to stay at a great location, this hotel shouldn't let you down.

Reviews.Title: “You get more what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: mindmeld
Reviews.Content: It is obviously one of the cheapest hotel in New York. It is also what it looks like. It is small and does not offer any special amenities. But who expects them for such a price? My room had a fridge, microwafe, flatscreen tv and a bathroom. That actually was the biggest suprise. I have stayed in many cheap hotels in New York but never had an own bathroom. That is very great! Do not expect huge rooms. Huge rooms you will not get for a low price in New York. Therefor the location is great. 3 minutes away from Times Square, 2 minutes away from many metro stations. The staff is very friendly and the lobby tries to help you in every needing. If you want a luxury hotel you would be wrong here. But if you want a cheap and clean hotel than you are going to be absolutely right here.

Reviews.Title: “Average Place, you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: kapatracey
Reviews.Content: Location and staff are the best parts of this place. Rooms are small, but their housekeeping is decent. Under $120 a night, I still think it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't expect much, but they did the job”
Reviews.Author: spiderliz
Reviews.Content: This hotel's got small rooms, but pretty clean. The front desk staff's really nice. They gave me a free late checkout and free wifi cuz I complained about the room being small.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic”
Reviews.Author: averyzip
Reviews.Content: basic small rooms with private bathroom. Not much amenities except hairdryer and fridge & microwave. At least my room was clean and we were all able to get nice quiet sleep. For the price and being 4 blocks away from Times Square, I think it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “It is not supposed to be called a hotel”
Reviews.Author: horrifiedcustomer
Reviews.Content: Upon most encounters with slovenly appearances, most would amend, fearing the thrifty and gaping caverns of dues to be paid. However, there is a crossing point: precisely where this slum seemed to have leaped off the pylons of great hotels, creating a tourist-friendly New York stay into paralytic asphyxiation of horror. It looms precariously on it's two-star rating. The distraught condition of drug predators and illegals cramming their holed guts into the trickling walls probably purchased the minimal rating. To this corroded stature of suckitude, I may ask to command you a simple trot away, scorchingly applying pressure to the gas pedal. First off, the "lobby" is a tight and small space... just like the stairway/room/elevator. Our room had no form of heating in the brutal cold of Manhattan. The bathroom door did not lock, "great". The bed was FILTHY!! STAINS! STAINS! HAIR ON THE BED! My goodness... there is no standards for this dump. The doors have stains... i don't know what it is? Mold? Feces? Basically, the room we had checked in online for about half a week was canceled the first hour we were there and the whole hour we were there was trying to book another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No Problem for me”
Reviews.Author: zkidd
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 3, stayed here for 5 nights, it was all good. Location was great, staff was friendly, housekeepers cleaned everyday. The place is like a european hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kvenus
Reviews.Content: I had a nice 4-day stay here with my friends. Can't beat the location and price here. The staff is really helpful and friendly about everything. Only if the rooms are a little bigger...

Reviews.Title: “The most disgusting, unsanitary place i have ever been.”
Reviews.Author: ajm1mom
Reviews.Content: I wasn't very happy with this hotel, to say the very least! I think it is necessary to tell everyone what we experienced. This was by far the filthiest hotel I have ever seen! The beds had stains, hello kitty twin size blankets on queen size beds. The sheets had blood stains. There was duct tape on the bottom of the tub, i still dont know the reason.( probably for covering something.) (see picture below) Also, the tub had jets but they were completely full of black mold. I bought clorox and gloves to clean it ,but I wasted my time because it didnt come out!(see picture below) My daughter and I were too scared to sleep on the beds so we slept in our clothes, on a vinyl futon with my coat to cover us, with no pillows, needless to say! There werent any bath towels or washcloths in the bathroom, so we went downstairs to get some and they gave us mismatched torn beach towels with sailboats and pastel stripes.There was a screw stuck in the faucet so we could turn the water on(see picture below). The view was the least of my concerns but out of the bathroom window was barbed wire and a bunch of garbage.(see picture below). The phone had what appeared to be a pubic hair on the receiver. Two out of three of the lights didnt have bulbs in them(see picture below)There was a microwave and a refrigerator, but neither worked! We paid $300 for this!!! It should be a crime to misrepresent a hotel to this extreme!!! The pictures were very misleading! When you plan a trip, you need to be able to trust the pictures online as a fair description of a hotel. When you arrive at a hotel that you dont even feel safe staying in, its very disappointing! Overall I was so badly disgusted with this experience that I will probably never stay in NYC again!

Reviews.Title: “I'm coming back”
Reviews.Author: pkoon88
Reviews.Content: Clean and convenient your standard budget place I'm coming back in December!

Reviews.Title: “I HAVE NO WORDS !!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DublinSammy68
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in New York on several occasions - this simply cannot be described as a hotel, its a filthy , dingy, kip, above what seems to be a Japanes kareoke style restaurant !!!! The place was held together with selotape. I would not recommend it to a dog .................

Reviews.Title: “Do not be deceived by these people.”
Reviews.Author: nspring
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for a weekend in February and I've never been so disgusted in my life. We are both students and used to traveling on a budget and had very low expectations when booking this hotel. The overall feel of this place is just very seedy, we did not feel safe at all. The biggest red flag of this place is the cleanliness. When we arrived at check in time, they told us that we could not check in because our room was still being cleaned. We came back two hours later and were horrified-there was no way this room had been recently cleaned. The linens were all mismatched and it was clear that the pillow cases had not been changed recently, they reeked of BO, were stained and there were tiny black hairs scattered through out the beds. My friend and i actually stripped the beds of all the linens and slept in our clothes. The floor was dirty and dusty, crumbs everywhere and there were actually little piles of crusted flakes where a previous guest had taken out their contacts and they had dried and never been cleaned up. The bathroom was not any better, mold everywhere and stained towels. One of the bath towels was sewn together at the edges? The place was just really weird. None of the furniture in the entire hotel matches, which wouldn't really be a big deal if they weren't all broken or decaying or patio furniture. The beds in our room were white plastic with big pink hearts on the headboard and pink linens- we were so confused! Do they give different rooms to different people based on gender? Even if it was the cheapest hotel in Manhattan it would not be worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: jycamp888
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, but they're clean. Staff's pretty helpful and very friendly. Great location, I'd have to say. Overall, it's fare for the price.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: vidaBrasil
Reviews.Content: sujo,,muito sujo,,,aparebcia medonha,,,nunca se hospede nesse hotel

Reviews.Title: “Hotel”
Reviews.Author: misskw
Reviews.Content: I recently visited NYC for a few days, and stayed at this hotel. If you are looking for cheap and don't plan on staying in the room than this is it, BUT I'm sure you can find some where else to stay that is reasonable! The room is small and the lighting is terrible! The A/C didn't work well at all, and it was hot in the room, you got cooler air outside! The only thing going for this hotel was that Times Square was literally 2 blocks away!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here - this is not a hotel it's a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: NicolaJT2008
Reviews.Content: The entrance is grubby, narrow and poorly lit, as is much of the rest of the hotel. I was upgraded to a 'suite' which sounded great, but it wasn't, it's hard to explain exactly how bad this hotel was, I can't even call it a hotel it was a hostel at the most. Windows held in with electric tape, shower didn't work, hair dryer fixed together with tape, garden furniture in the room, random furniture and fittings through out, incredibly noisy both outside and inside the 'hostel'. Also people tried getting into my room during the night. The receptionist was truly shocked when I asked for a refund and checked out. I read the reviews before booking this hotel and unfortunately took them with a pinch of salt, this hotel was not cheap when I booked but it's not worth a penny, even my taxi driver said he wouldn't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “like living in a Shoebox - avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: JabberwockyIndia
Reviews.Content: Way over priced. Rooms are pigeon holes, no cupboard, no furniture other than a glass table and chair. The baths were not clean. The hotel has a seedy feel. The service is good and staff very helpful... but what is the use when you don't feel like going back to your room?! Ideally should cost 70 dollars a day for someone to justify the stay. look around - there are better places in New York in the same area for the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place to crach”
Reviews.Author: shaw_katie3
Reviews.Content: If you don't plan to stay in your room all day, and can't spend more than $150 a night on a room in nyc, this place is an option. It's got the basics, tv, phone, clean bathroom, clean sheets & towels, wifi... I didn't mind it at all, plus it was close to so many attractions and shopping

Reviews.Title: “Completely suitable for a 3-day trip on a budget”
Reviews.Author: averyck1
Reviews.Content: Wow, the reviews are so bad, I feel like I need to stand up for this place. Look, it's not the Four Seasons, but for the price, it's really a decent place. We were close to everything, from sightseeing to shopping to dinning to the broadway shows. Rooms were small, but clean. The front desk agents there are super friendly and having wifi helped. So my friends and I had a good time and saved a bunch, so it was all good.

Reviews.Title: “I could lose my job for booking this hotel for my executives- horrible.”
Reviews.Author: 5thtravelgal
Reviews.Content: This hotel has become a travel coordinator's worst nightmare! I book travel for a company of 80+, and I always looking for a great deal in the best location. The hotel I normally book for our executives travel to New York City was unavailable, so I searched for a decent replacement... and unfortunately found myself looking at this horribly misleading hotel. I found the Manhattan Broadway Budget Hotel on Expedia- the pictures looked great- modern, clean, hip- the pictures posted are not the same hotel. I booked the hotel and pre-paid for 2 nights. When I heard word from my travels of the actual condition of the hotel I was appalled. Mold growing everywhere, broken window that was duct taped together, stained furniture, stained linens, broken A/C, no closet, stiff beds, doors don't properly work, etc., etc., etc. DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL- YOU WILL REGRET IT! If my executives weren't as understanding as they are, I could seriously lose my job for booking them in this location. I will never make this mistake again- pay the extra money, it's worth your safety!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Suzzycab
Reviews.Content: We are well travelled and this is the worst hotel ever. For paying $229.11. It's a total scam. It's not even considered hotel. It was the worst mistake I've ever done choosing a hotel. I was just attracted byt the name and the location and it's my fault i didnt read much of the reviews. Please dont make the same mistake i"ve done. The room si too small . The beds are not even proper beds. the 2nd bed is just a folding bed. The bed sheets are terrible black and got stains on it that looks like been used already, The towels are ripped and when i ask for anohter one the guy didnt even say sorry. No proper table The bathroom is is not a proper bathroom. It's not a hotel at all the remote control of the Airconditioner is filthy , you dont even want to touch it. the electrical wires and connections are not properly installed. This hotel should close down and have complete renovation. I am not exaggerating believe me. We cant even sit down on the bed. Everything feels dirty in that room. It smells the moment we got in co.z they dont have the aircondition on.I dont know how did it pass in the Hotel Association of New York. It's worst than small motels. We just leave out stuff there for the day, came back at 11 night time and moved to Distrikt Hotel close by. Brand New hotel , It's immaculate, with king size bed and everything is high tech.The price is even cheaper by 10 dollars. People please dont make the same mistake we had. I'm telling you the truth.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: Ausielyn
Reviews.Content: Disgusting hovel the owners should be reported for false representation.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay”
Reviews.Author: MichiganMim
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only 2 nights and had to switch our rooms 2 times. This "hotel" is not very clean. It had very large "dust bunnies", bathroom lighing is horrible, bathroom mirror was so marked up you couldn't see in it. No wash clothes unless you went down to the front desk and ask for thim. Towels were very ruff and many holes in them. Very loud air conditioners (in the windows). No central air. Elevator is extremely small!! Please do not stay here if you are handicapped. Location was a little out the way, it would have been OK if the hotel had been clean. We travel to NYC about 2 times a year and I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, everything else ....”
Reviews.Author: xyz1999
Reviews.Content: The Manhatten Broadway Hotel is perfectly located in the heart of Manhatten. The Time Square as well as several other important locations for tourism can be easily reached by walking. But the location is the only positive thing that can be reported about this hotel. The room we had, and which was booked for three persons, was the smallest room I ever have seen in a hotel, the double bed and the extra bed together filled the room completly, so that only one of our suitcases could be opened at the same time. The air conditioning was making noise but did not provide cool air. At night there was very loud music and the window did not help reducing the noise. When we arrived at the hotel the first ask to pay 30 $ cash, that we can enter the room some hours earlier. We even had to pay an extra fee, that at the day of departure we could store our luggage for some more hours in the hote, what I also never experienced before.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: lindabell88
Reviews.Content: After the reviews, I was really not looking forward to staying there, but what do you know, it was a pleasant surprise. We are group of 4 and got a room with two full beds. Everything works in the room, wifi, running water, lights ... The staff was super friendly and helpful. So I must say, next time I'm in new york, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed my stay w/ friends”
Reviews.Author: katlinpeat
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at this place for 5 days and we enjoyed it. They're pretty close to all the sights, the agents there are really helpful with everything. The Wifi's cheap, the rooms are tiny, but clean and comfortable. We were on a tight budget, so it worked out for us.

Reviews.Title: “Waaaaaaaay overpriced for a glorified youth hostel”
Reviews.Author: linnea625
Reviews.Content: Tiny room that smelled of mold, broken bed tied together with string, STAINED sheets, dirty bathroom (mold growing in shower), door didn't close properly, VERY loud and you could hear everything going on the in hallway, slow elevator, outrageously overpriced for what you get. Even the towels smelled like mildew and they are so cheap,the towels had clearly been cut from a larger towel and then hemmed, so you don't even get a full sized towel. DO NOT STAY HERE. The ONLY good thing about the hotel is it's location.

Reviews.Title: “ruin your vacation”
Reviews.Author: Lennie23
Reviews.Content: This may be the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. In freezing winter there was no heat. The best they could do was switch us to a room that didn't have such big windows. The rooms are tiny, and I mean tiny. Not particularly clean either. The lobby is a thin joke, but that's not all that important. This hotel convinced me that if you are going to have a vacation for fun, you need to spend some money on a decent hotel and not let crap like this one ruin your vacation. Still, it isn't that cheap because the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “You can't get any closer to the action at this incredible price!”
Reviews.Author: travel-hawthorne
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong. This is no luxury hotel. Still, it is in the heart of Manhattan with Times Square at your feet. We stayed only one night, 3 people in 1 big bed and another person in a single bed. The room was tiny, the bathroom clean, the water hot, the feeling secure. We would happily go back again. You can't get any cheaper than this in Manhattan. If you pre-pay with no refunds, you get an even better deal. Wake up folks, how much time do you really spend in the hotel anyway?

Reviews.Title: “No problem for me”
Reviews.Author: chrlr599
Reviews.Content: The reviews here are kinda polar opposites, but I guess you get what you pay for. My friends and I paid for a 3 person room at ab out $150 a night. They're close to almost everything. Wifi was offered. The rooms were small, but very clean. I think our bathroom was recently renovated. So if you're not expecting four seasons, then this hotel's not bad for the price.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel on earth very dirty and not nice at all and very expensive it is like a youth hostel”
Reviews.Author: lenajeru
Reviews.Content: better to sleep on the street you do not have a lobby and extra charges for everything if been there once you will never come back there

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel EVER!!!!! Next time I'd rather stay in a youth Hostel...it won't be as expensive”
Reviews.Author: Cangrejitooo
Reviews.Content: The photos on their webpage MUST be fake!!!! We paid $200 per night in this hole!!! The room and bathroom was dirty, you had no place to hang your clothes or put your luggage. The room was very small and in general very unkept. The walls were dirty, the door had paint all over it, and the room was like a box. The room had one tiny window, through which no light came in. Every single night we had to go and reset the door key (a card) because it never worked. Most of the staff was friendly, except a chinese guy, who was rather rude and even sold me a phone card with CHINESE INSTRUCTIONS!!!! The only good thing about it is the location, but that's it!!! There's nothing good about this place...NOTHING!!!!!!!! I'd rather sleep in a Central Park bench or something....at least I would know when it was day again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all for the price”
Reviews.Author: jcollins549
Reviews.Content: Paid $150 a night here, split 3 ways with my fds. We were close to lots of places, time square, macys, msg... theres wifi in the rooms. They also hooked us up with some comedy tickets I wouldn't mind stayin here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pitiful”
Reviews.Author: daydreamhigh
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I spoke to the hotel I was assured that their hotel was nice and that we would be taken care of with no problems.Well their idea of no problems differs greatly from mine. To begin with,there was no hot water from 2pm one day until 7am the next day.Their reason was that they only had one hot water heater.The only heat in the room was from a small portable space heater.There were no wash clothes or water glasses.The bath tub had no plug so that you could only take a shower.The only upside was the bed was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Average place, worth it for the rate!”
Reviews.Author: kcraig5555
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small, but clean. Paid $100 a night with a couple of friends, its definitely worth it. They even have wifi in the rooms for a small place like that.

Reviews.Title: “Neat place w lots to see in the area”
Reviews.Author: katiestrks
Reviews.Content: This is your standard budget hotel. Bed, private bathrooms (thank god), housekeepers come daily, wifi in the rooms, about $100 a night, I'd pay that for being 4 blocks away from time square. Spent 3 days there w my friend, had a great time in nyc

Reviews.Title: “Good for business”
Reviews.Author: lars-123
Reviews.Content: Simple, clean & housekeepers and front desk clerks are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not getting your money's worth.”
Reviews.Author: nike07
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a hotel close to Times Square and you don't care about anything as long as it has a bed, and bath then this is the place for you. However, I stayed in a 1 bed room, room, and when i say 1 bed room i mean just one bed room, with a full bath. Small tv, bathroom door that doesn't latch, semi hard bed, broken spring on main door that does not allow it to self close, view out of windows sucks (it's an alley). The Workers are very nice however, it does not compaire to the hotel it's self

Reviews.Title: “friendly & Clean place”
Reviews.Author: leehelen39
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, staff was friendly, location was excellent. Good enought for me.

Reviews.Title: “DUMP, DUMP, DUMP!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AmyGeorgia
Reviews.Content: This was the absolute worst hotel (if you can classify it as one) I have ever seen in my entire life! My boyfriend and I took a spontaneous trip to New York and did not have much time for planning. We looked at the pictures on the internet and it seemed like a decent place to stay, especially that is was close to Times Square. When we walked in the room, I felt like we were walking into a jail cell. The room was so small, it was nasty, and had a fowl odor. There was one tiny window that would not even open! I immediately called the front desk and told him this was false advertisement and he gave me another room. The "upgrade" was also a nasty dump. I would not even take a shower there. When I layed down in the bed that felt like I was laying on bricks, I felt like things were going to crawl on me! I would not recommend this hotel to a stray animal.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: cherrylabc
Reviews.Content: I work for a small business, we don't have the funds to stay at the four seasons, so the company got us a room at this hotel and it was just fine with me. We each stayed in their standard Queen size bed room. It had everything we needed. Private bathroom, cable TV, desk, wardrobe, We had to pay for our WIFI, $10 for the week, not so bad considering the price of the room. So yea, definitely a hidden gem, this place.

Reviews.Title: “Well Woth it”
Reviews.Author: neolili14
Reviews.Content: Average Rooms but very clean, awesome staff, great location... well worth it for the price

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY unless you want to add to the bodily function stains....”
Reviews.Author: nat55dvm
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to be next to the place my girlfriend was interviewing at. We walked into the room and wanted to vomit. There were worn spots and stains on the sheets and urine staining (clearly from decades of men missing the toilet) on the bathroom floor, and a spongelike mold growing out of the "drain" of the "jet" tub. It was absolutely disgusting. AND...even though we walked in and walked right back out.....they would NOT refund our money. It was worth it to call hotels.com and find a great place at Broadway Plaza Hotel for only $10.00 more a night. I would stay very very far away. Bed bugs, urine, and who knows what other things lurk here. I've stayed in placed with cockroaches and ants crawling the walls that were better than this place.....

Reviews.Title: “Dont even think about it - Trust me”
Reviews.Author: DonSoleil
Reviews.Content: THE WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER SEEN! Dirty, dirty, old horrible furniture, smells bad and just not classified as a hotel I didnt even stay there, walked in saw the place and walked out. It even cost me a night as they wouldnt refund my money but i didnt care. Comfort Inn right across the street is so much better for even cheaper. Trust me, I never write reviews but I HAD TO TO WRITE THIS TO SAVE THE NEXT PERSON FROM EVER GOING THERE.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Gloria H
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a mid range hotel in a FANTASTIC location in NYC, you cannot go past this little gem. 2 blocks from a Subway station, 8 from a great row of restaurants, 4 from the Empire State Building, 12 from Central Park, in the heart of the Garment district, this hotel screams LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION. The Manhattan Broadway Hotel is not exactly cheap, but for NYC, they do charge a fairly decent rate. You get what you pay for - which is a fairly clean room that is serviced almost every day (a bit of a "hit and miss" here - our room was missed for 2 days despite requests), phone & TV, internal bathroom (don't look at the bottom hem of the shower curtain if you're squeamish about mould spots), soap bars, hair dryer and tiny scratchy towels. One of the greatest things about this hotel is their staff - very friendly and helpful people with good recommendations and suggestions for the intrepid tourist. The hotel has internet service and WiFi - USD$5 for 30 mins internet, or USD$3 for WiFi. A bit on the expensive side, so if you're looking for free WiFi, I'd suggest heading into ANY Starbucks - there are plenty of Starbucks outlets around, with one only 1 block away. If we were to return to NYC in the future on a similar budget to what we had this time around, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Try for an upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: bamalove2travel
Reviews.Content: Not sure how to respond to some of the reviews...I'm sure the pics don't lie, but there are good rooms to be had here. Traveled with three friends and stayed for three nights with no problems. However, we were given an upgrade when we arrived, so maybe there's a marked difference between the rooms. Ours wasn't spacious, but it was clean and the beds were comfortable. Same w/the private bathroom. As far as things like the size of the TVs, who cares? Who's in NYC to watch TV? I want a room that feels relatively safe and that is clean, and that's what I got. Small fridge in room was a plus. My only real issue was the extremely tiny elevator, as I sometimes had to wait for a second trip since literally only one person could ride at the time with any luggage at all. I'd also read in some reviews that the smell and noise of the restaurant below was an issue...in my room, it absolutely was not. There is also a nicely stocked bodega just around the corner that's quite convenient. Based on my stay, I would stay here again...and ask for an upgrade!

Reviews.Title: “Fit all my needs”
Reviews.Author: braziliansaver
Reviews.Content: Location, w38th street, near 8th avenue.............better impossible, low fare for a small clean room with private bath, nice staff...........everything a needed on my 7-day trip to nyc, saving a hundred dollars a day in comparison with the other hotels of that area. Probably I'll be there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there 8 nights, no problem”
Reviews.Author: aprilkate70
Reviews.Content: I was there with my friends for a week and it was all we'd ask for from a budget hotel. There was Wifi in the room, the place was clean, even though the room was small, but clean. Front desk staff helped us a lot with tips to travel around and places to go and how not to get ripped off in nyc. They were so nice. So if you have less than $200 a night to spend on a hotel, i'd try them out.

Reviews.Title: “This place can't be qualified as a hotel”
Reviews.Author: 101709e
Reviews.Content: I decided to go to NY without proper planning so I had almost no options of hotels, specially because the city was having the america nations event. I checked their website and it seemed like a good place. When I arrived in my room I was mortified. This was the worst hotel room I have ever seen. The mattress wore terrible, the floor was dirty. There was no windows. The towels were not good at all. It seems like I was renting a room in a dump!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: pmfraz
Reviews.Content: Don't be decieved by the pictures on the web site. This hotel is a dump. The sheets look as if the last guest slept on them. The towels in the bathroom was dingy, hard and stained with a brown substance. The blanket over the bed was filthy dirty. There was mo maid service on the Sunday of my stay...(was there Sat, Sun and Mon.) The "flat screen TV was smaller that my desktop computer monitor at home. Anyone who gave this hotel any type of a good rating must live in a house w/ rats and roaches because that was the only thing this hotel was lacking in order to be called a geheto/slum of a hotel. If you stay here...you are a fool. You've been warned.

Reviews.Title: “great value for 65$ a night.”
Reviews.Author: eurowatz
Reviews.Content: first of all, we didn`t expect much. if you only pay 65$ for a double room with bath and shower enclosed, that couldn´t be located any better, you shouldn´t think of hilton. we also read the reviews posted here, so we expected the worst conditions, just hoping not to be eaten by bugs. contrary to our expectations the service was friendly, the beds were very comfotable and made every day. you have tv, (working) aircondition and our room was totaly quiet. sure and you will find some dust if you re looking for it and there is not panoramic view but a dirty backyard seen from the window, but the price-value ratio seems unbeatable to me. reading some of the older reviews i guess there must have been some kind of renovation since. again: it`s clean, it perfectly located, they help if you need them and its very very cheap!

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a comfortable, clean, good valued, great location hotel, than this hotel is just right for you.”
Reviews.Author: AFemaleTorontonian
Reviews.Content: While many people rate this hotel poorly, they have there expectations much too high for a hotel at this price. When you walk in, your first thought might not be welcoming but if you give the place a second glance you can see how charming and inviting the hotel looks. The beds were relaxing and comfortable, and the bathroom clean and spacious. There are no bugs, rodents, peeling wallpaper in any of the rooms. In our room we had five people, three beds, and still had plenty of room for our belongings. There was also a sliding door so if you wanted to seperate the room in half for some privacy. There was also a microwave, refrigerator, and a tv. The location was convenient and nearby all the main attracions and sight-seing locations. The staff was friendly and willing to help with any situation that was bothersome to your experience. This hotel is a great choice to stay at when you want a convenient, reliable, comfortable, clean, and friendly hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: aaawilson08
Reviews.Content: Just ok. It was cheap kinda dirty but for NYC at that price it is worth it. I have been told it has been refurbished since my visit not sure if it has made much of a difference. The location is AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: lou169
Reviews.Content: This place is down right depressing. The pictures they show on the internet must be from another Hotel. The room was beyond small. Bathroom dirty & the room smelt of mold & very musty. The tv was like, a nine inch screen & no alarm clock for the AM. This is more of a Motel than a Hotel. I stayed out all night just so I didn't have to be in the room. Don't say you weren't warned!!

Reviews.Title: “It was dirty dumpy noisy tile corridors in the middle of renovations and we were not told”
Reviews.Author: travellinoz
Reviews.Content: Finally I found somewhere I could write a review about this place to save others our pain. I see now on their website they have renovated somewhat. WE were NOT told at the time of our booking they were in the middle of renovations. Courtesy would at least grant that and give us the choice. Hopefully they have changed their ways but after reading latest reviews perhaps not. Towels were dirty, bathroom floor was dirty and room was dirty. I had to clean the bath before I could use it. Bed was hard, bedding disgusting. Glad it was a brief trip. They tried to put us in a room that had just been painted and the window didn't open at first. Then we asked for another room which had patches of carpet on the floor. Forget this hotel if you are light sleeper, tile floors line the hallways and suitcases rolling on the floors are noisy as is anyone walking by. We were on a tight budget and had to be in NYC that day. For around $170 at the time what a rip off!!!! I will go without food and save money to stay in a decent place and thankfully we have since found other hotels better quality for a cheaper price. Oh and yes there is no elevator and if they didn't have my credit card number I would have left on arrival after seeing the foyer!

Reviews.Title: “Don't DO it!”
Reviews.Author: goegirls
Reviews.Content: My two daughters & I booked a last minute trip to NYC & ended up staying here because most everything was full or WAY beyond our budget. It was a mistake. It was by far the worst place we've ever stayed! Our 1st cllue should have been the "lobby" entryway, which was really just a long hallway that they were repairing. We had to drag our suitcases over broken concrete & tile, & step over several tools that they left right in the way. Our room was filthy, hot, primitive & SO cramped for 3 people. The bedding & carpet were really dirty! There was no space to set our luggage other than on the beds, & no room for anyt makeup in the bathroom. We were only given 3 small, thin towels each day, no washcloths. The light in the bathroom was burned out, & when I called the front desk they sent someone up with a new light bulb & a plastic milk crate for us to stand on & fix ourselves! For some reason,the dead bolt on the door had been removed. Worst of all, there was absolutely no fire escape other that the stairs that we walked up to get to our room. If a fire would break out before the steps, there would have been no way out! During our 4 night stay there we never felt clean, comfortable or safe. I really don't know how they are still legally operating!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what the website looked like..."”
Reviews.Author: TourAroundTheWorld
Reviews.Content: When I looked at the hotel online and saw the pictures it looked like a modern, updated, boutique hotel. When I got there (my friends had already checked in) I walked into a small hallway (granted most everything in NYC is small) and asked for my key from the front desk. I asked for the elevator and they pointed to the corner. It barely fit 3 people. And took forever to get to the lobby. I get to the room and open the door and wasn't exactly what I expected. So before I writing this review I noticed something about the pictures on their website... they are computer generated previews like what you see on HGTV of what your room WILL look like when its done. Well, the rooms look nothing like those computer generated images. I walked into the room and saw two beds, with mis-matched bedding. When I went to the bathroom, the "floor mat" looked like an old beach towel. The toilet leaked. The beds were not very comfortable, and the only reason we were able to sleep was because we had all been up all night out on the town and were dead tired. I even saw a bug (roach maybe) walk across the wall. The room was hot, but the "a/c" (room cooler, the kind you stick in the window) did its job in cooling down the room. Room was pretty small, we kept tripping over our luggage (and we packed LIGHT). I mean I guess you get what you pay for in NYC, b/c I visited in September 2008 and paid twice as much but had an awesome hotel. The location was great, as we were able to walk to so many things. Would I stay again? Not if I can afford to pay a little more. Considering we mainly used the room to shower, and one night of sleep in 3 two nights, it wouldn't have been worth paying $300 some where else. Oh you had to pay $3 to get internet access.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kbctrip
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a complete nightmare. The room was small, dirty, smelly and extremely hot.3 different colors of paint just slapped on the crusty wall. When I asked for a different room I was giving one with no sheets on the rock hard bed, the toilet didn't flush and the sink was clogged and overflowing with water. When we checked out we waited at the counter for 15-20 min with no service. When the only lady working came from the outside the hotel she explained that she had forgot to get cofee so she went down the street to get some. Anyone could have just walked in while she was gone. The place is just a totall wreck. If your thinking "how bad could it be" trust me when I say you don't want to find out.

Reviews.Title: “bad and expensive”
Reviews.Author: RaquelPonsati
Reviews.Content: The room was terrible, dirty, totally diferent of ALL the pictures I saw in the internet, I couldn't Believe when the taxi stopped in front of that! The location was the only good thing on that!

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: apeters0001
Reviews.Content: This was a surprise. My friend booked the room and I read the review at the airport and was terrified, but we had a pleasant time there. The rooms are small, but clean. The staff's very friendly and helpful. Their lacation was the best part, we were close to the broadway shows and time sq which is exactly what we were wanted. So if are on a budget and don't mind things like having to pick up toilet paper or towels from the front desk sometimes, or having a big, nice lobby, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Never returning”
Reviews.Author: MadamJay
Reviews.Content: Location: Fantastic. Very convenient to everywhere and very central. Probably the only good thing about this hotel. Cleanliness: I didn't feel good about this one. The towels they provided had hair in them. And there was no differentiation between floor mats (for the bathroom) and towels. So the towel you are using now could have jolly well be used as a floor mat by someone else. Rooms: Extremely tight. Do not look anything like the photos on the website. No windows, so you don't know if it's night or day. The lighting in the room is very poor. The walls are extremely thin and the corridor extremely narrow. Last night, there were like 10-15 people in the room next to ours. No kidding. And they were having a 'party'. Talking, screaming, basically making a ruckus. Although we called up the receptionist to complain, he wasn't effective in making them stop. This lasted for 1-2 hours. Finally, we had to threaten to call the police before the noise stopped. And even so, the noise returned 2 hours later. It was then 4am. Service: The people at the reception were pretty nice and helpful, especially the Asian lady. Value: You get what you pay for. For $108 a night triple sharing, what kind of luxuries do you expect? Would I return? Never.

Reviews.Title: “So It's not the Ritz!!!”
Reviews.Author: rdsmom98
Reviews.Content: My sons and I stayed here for our New York experience! 2 Blocks from Times Square, 2 Blocks from Penn Station. First reaction when we arrived was "What have I done???" But our stay was a pleasant one. It's not the Ritz Carleton by any means, but there were NO BUGS, NO MICE! It cost $300 for 3 NIGHTS!!!! Try getting a room that close to Times Square for less than $300 a night! The lady at the front desk was very pleasant. I WILL stay here again, if we ever go to New York again! You get what you pay for. It's a room with beds to sleep in. It was clean, we got our time call when needed, it was perfect. If you are going to New York City, and not going just to stay in a hotel then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay There!”
Reviews.Author: Anastassia
Reviews.Content: There is only one good thing about this place-loction! It is close to everything! Otherwise the place is disgusting, the rooms are freezing, the whole hotel is dirty, staff is indifferent, walls are made of paper, you can hear everything on the entire floor and when someone walks past your door, feels like the hotel will fall apart! We had to sleep in clothes for 3 nights because bedding is stained and dirty...or bring your own bedding. But truly, would never recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: y2j_2001_2002
Reviews.Content: Ok, i booked well before i had read the reviews, but i was shocked to actually find the opposite of the reviws i read. It is very close to many of nyc top sights and only 2 blocks away from a subway line, Starbucks 2 blocks away. Staff was very informative, very helpful, rooms were small but i didn't visit nyc to stay in the room all day, as i only slept and was up and out, and the day before i was leaving they booked a shuttle to pick me up, and even called the shuttle co. just to make sure they would be on time at 4am. Now thats quality!

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: nbrunell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not nice. It also is very inexpensive for its location in New York City. The location is far and away the best aspect of this hotel. Only minutes from subway stations, and Times Square, fifth ave. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was fine, but it seemed rundown. There were no amenities, the walls are paper thin, and in general the hotel is not very clean. But staying for one night, for under 100 dollars 5 minutes from Times Square!! is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Would rather stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: VILLAgeorge
Reviews.Content: Ugly place to stay. Besides bad quality in furniture, bad smell, etc., there were too many young tourists coming from God knows where, who started shouting from room to room, at 7 a.m. Lousy, to say the least. The personnel tried to be kind, but for 3 hundred bucks per night (1 person), I would have better stayed somewhere else, maybe farther from Broadway ave.; maybe even in New Jersey. Stay here only if you have no other choice, otherwise you will regret as I did... ... btw, the pictures are deceiving: they look so sunny and clean, but the real deal is dark, humid and uncomfortable, as other user pointed out. I hope I was helpful. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Not that Bad!”
Reviews.Author: moetallica81
Reviews.Content: The other reviews scared me, but I already booked this place before I read them. I don't know about all the other rooms, but our room was pretty nice (not huge), but was very comfortable. I requested a room with two queen beds and not only got 2 queens, but two singles as well! Really cool! The T.V. was small and not very many channels, but hey, we weren't there to watch T.V.! Great location. Nice folks working there. If you go there, request room 309. That was ours. Not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience with the staff!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: klhg
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible experience with the staff. We had an issue with our credit card and the GM was rude, condoscending and I would even say prejudiced against women. He refused to be helpful, when he could clearly see this was an issue beyond our control. We had called (later) to follow up and he hung up the phone on me twice! What kind of proffessional service is that?! The hotel itself is small, cramped and not as clean as we expected. I would definately not stay there again and would not recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: server01
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a nightmare booked a room that was suppose to have 2 queen beds, got a room that had a twin and double, requested a new room after seeing cockroaches. The next room wasn't much better it had friggin bunkbeds and barely had room to move. Forget the fact that we couldn't even check in until after 6pm because the room wasn't ready after I even called at 3pm and was assured the room was ready. Front desk help was from mars. Oh and after we were told the room was cleaned and ready we found a bunch of empty beer cans on the ledge. We requested towels because the only left 2 got more towels that were like sandpaper and no wash cloths. The front desk guy reminded me this was a budget hotel but I think that paying over $300,00 for a nights stay constitutes a little better quality.

Reviews.Title: “Stay only if you must”
Reviews.Author: okstatefan
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to go into the details of the problems my daughter and I had when we stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. I just want to say don't stay there unless you have no other choice. It is a miserable place, cold, loud and smelly with a mostly rude desk staff. This was my second trip to New York and as much as I like New York and hope to go again, if the Mahattan Broadway Hotel is the only place to stay, I will not go.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't as bad as I thought it would be!”
Reviews.Author: Moaneekwa
Reviews.Content: Okay...so my girlfriend and I stayed here in Jan of 08. And then once again in April of 08. Well...it wasn't as bad as I had thought. All the scary reviews and things...I feel bad for those people that went through that. We got pretty okay rooms. They were small, like everyone said, but I guess with just the two of us, that's okay. The 2nd time we stayed there, there were 4 of us. And well we actually got a room with 3 beds...one was a bunk bed, queen size, might I add, and then a single bed. And it was nice...very plain room, but it's NYC! You don't wanna be in your hotel room all that long anyway! All you wanna do is see the sights and have fun, you won't be spending all that much time in there anyway! That's what you just have to think of if you do end up getting a room that's horrible, but if it IS unbareable, then it's okay to ask for something nicer, etc. But we got what we paid for, and it was actually nice than I thought. The first night when we stayed...in Jan we paid $117. The 2nd time...was with the 4 of us it was $138. So...not all that bad, I cannot complain! I had a great time, and I will be staying at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Good for Family of Five”
Reviews.Author: ozfamily5
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we are a family of five, and needed a single room to accommodate us. From the reviews, I was expecting something very rundown, but I was pleasantly surprised. Our room (109) was smartly painted in refreshing two-tone blues, and was quite appealing. The room was almost a 2 room suite, with 2 queen beds in the main section and another bed + trundle in a partitioned area, plus a bathroom with bathtub. It had a wardrobe, a good sized bar fridge with small freezer section and even had a microwave. Also a flatscreen TV mounted on the wall. The bath towels were generally small and thin, but you can ask for bigger, thicker towels. A real bonus is that the housekeeper will do a fair-sized bag of laundry for only $10. We bought breakfast supplies at a nearby Duane Reade store and ate in our room mornings. For dinner, try the GoGo Curry (Japanese) restaurant adjacent to the hotel for a cheap but excellent meal. The area is noisy, especially weekends, but the noise is quite effectively masked by the a/c unit. Finally, the location in central Manhattan is fantastic, very close to Times Square and the Empire State Building.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, but a good value”
Reviews.Author: kymberand
