Reviews.Content: I had to make a very last-minute trip to NYC and booked this hotel just for a place to sleep. I chose this hotel because, of the very few hotels in Manhatten with rooms available on 24 hours notice, it was the only one that cost less than about $300 per night. Which isn't to say it was cheap, but it was the best price available by far. The hotel is extremely basic, containing only the rooms and a front desk which is not clearly signed as belonging to the hotel. The location is easy enough to find if you have the address (and is a short walk from Penn Station), but there is nothing resembling an actual hotel entrance or lobby. However I was aware of this all in advance and was therefore not bothered by it. The room itself was completely acceptable - not huge but large enough, with a clean and functional bathroom. The bed was comfortable. The room seemed quite clean overall and I saw absolutely no sign of bugs - but since other reviewers have mentioned this is it still worth checking carefully (I did). Overall, an acceptable place to stay if you just need a bed for the night and are on a budget (or feeling cheap, as I was). Probably not a place I'd stay for more than a night or two, however.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Location Budget Hotel. Don´t be scared with the bad reviews.”
Reviews.Author: checourtney
Reviews.Content: I´m traveling with a group of 15 students, i´ve visited N.Y. four times before and stayed at the Hudson Hotel one time and at different midtown hostels the other two. Saving the proportions (Hudson Hotel was designed by Phillippe Starck), the rooms of the Hudson Hotel are the same size as the Manhattan Broadway. At hostels you´ve to share bathrooms, not at the Manhattan Broadway. The staff service is great, they´re very helpful. The security around the area is great, it´s New York City, so you might see some crazy stuff, a lot of noise and small details every budget hotel has. Definately there are NO rats or roaches, at least we didn´t see them or hear them..... The facade is awful but who cares.... and so on. My point is: Don´t be scared by the reviews... if youre not a picky person, this is your hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Decent Budget Type of Hotel”
Reviews.Author: josephreyes
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was quite worth it. The lobby's ugly, but the rooms are quite nice and clean. The housekeepers and front desk people are really helpful. For about $150 a night, 5 minutes away from time square, not bad at all!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel In The World”
Reviews.Author: rahi1020
Reviews.Content: Lets see VERY NOISY. Staff came into the room at least 10 times asking for housekeeping when we had the do not disturb sign posted on the door. They didn't even care to knock they just opened the door flat out. The receptionist was VERY rude and very unaccommodating. BUGS in the room, and don’t even get me started on the room itself. It was more of a walk in closet then anything else. This place isn't worth it even if you're on a budget. I would rather pay 50 $ more and get something better. Do yourself a favor and don’t stay in this crap hole.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for an inexpensive stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: kinsleylarry
Reviews.Content: This isn't that bad of a place considering all the awful review it's gotten. Stayed here for 3 nights for a business trip and was just fine. the place is clean, helpful staff and the location was perfect to get to almost anywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: orclev
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the negative reviews for this place, my boyfriend and I were pretty scared about staying at this hotel. The lobby really isn't terribly impressive, I must admit. It's more like a hallway with a desk and a vending machines and two available computers for internet access at the end. A bit more like a college dorm than a hotel, but if you consider that the hotel has "Budget" in the name, then it's really not surprising that the lobby isn't all fancy and sparkling like the Ritz Carlton or something. Plus the staff at the desk is always very friendly and helpful, which is a definite plus. Elevator was a bit cramped going up; two people with luggage is almost a tight fit -- with one more random person in there it's quite tight. Once we got to our actual room, we both breathed a sigh of relief and even laughed a little, because it was much, MUCH better than what we were expecting after all of the bad reviews. We had two double beds (we only used one -- we weren't the ones who booked the room, so that isn't the hotel's fault), which were fairly comfortable and the sheets were clean. The lighting in the room was particularly nice, and there were no bulky lamps or anything taking up space; everything was creatively wall mounted, and it created a very nice atmosphere in the room, especially with the addition of the one wall that was painted bright red...you will see this in the pictures. The bathroom was clean and there were towels, which were a bit on the thin side...we brought our own towels, however, so that was not a problem (I recommend that you bring your own toiletries as well). I think the bathtub may have actually been a jacuzzi at one point, but the jets were sealed over... Shower worked nicely. We saw absolutely NO bugs or rodents of any kind while we were there. The only noise we heard was in the hallways when housekeeping was out making rounds, or when there were people in the hallways making a lot of loud noises....so a bit more like a college dorm or an apartment in terms of hallway noise as well. We were on the 3rd floor, and I didn't really hear any street noise from where we were. Our room was also well-heated. The only problem we had was shortly before we left, when the toilet got clogged, and the plunger that was provided with the bathroom (which I think is a good idea; I see few hotels that do this, and I would really rather plunge my own toilet and save the embarrassment of calling someone else to do it for me) didn't work as well as it should have... But we let them know about it on checkout, and the lady at the desk made a note about it in the logs and thanked us for telling her, so I assume they sent someone to fix the toilet and maybe replace the plunger. Kudos to them for being on top of things. I would totally stay here again, though. The location is FANTASTIC -- we walked everywhere we went, no need to take any taxis at all. :) (Not sure if I would recommend for business travelers though, since our room did not include a desk. This did not affect us at all, however, since we were just tourists who needed a comfortable place to sleep at night.)

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wolser
Reviews.Content: Was expecting hotel to be poor if not terrible after reading reviews on trip advisor. Was not prepared for what we discovered. Nobody even heard of the hotel, bugs in the rooms, rooms not cleaned, leaking toilet, very noisy etc and the receptionist advised us we were getting the best room in the hotel. A joke ! Don`t know how they are even allowes keep this place opened. Awful !!!! We spent very little time in the hotel but still would not dream of reccomending it what so ever. Worst hotel I have ever come accross !!!!!!!!!!!! Don`t book it !!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here, mice!”
Reviews.Author: DublinCasper
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one week, what an experience. Just pay the extra few quid to stay up the road in the New Yorker for a cheap break. I was there with my partner and parents. We both had to change rooms three times each due to mice and overflowing toilets. Woke up one morning with a mouse running across the bed and shelf. No wardrobes in any of the three rooms I moved too. We didn't feel safe or secure in hotel. We wondered if this hotel rented rooms out by the hour... On my return I have contacted hotels.com to complain, This hotel should not be listed on their website, it is a health hazard. Only thing this hotel (really a hostel) has going for it is the location. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Expect a Budget Hotel and you will not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bonedaddy1965
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews on here, I was very apprehensive about staying here, but decided to give it a shot anyway. Keeping in mind that this is a budget hotel, I was relatively pleased with my accomodations. Yes, there was a lot of street noise and it certainly wasn't a luxury hotel, but they were upfront and honest about the place, which is more than can be said for many claiming to be something they aren't. The front desk staff were extremely courteous and helpful in all situations, which is MUCH more than I can stay for help in other hotels in the area that I have paid 5X more per night tha I did here. There was soap, but no other toiletries provided, so bring your own, and if you are picky about your towels and have room in your luggage, that may be a good idea too. They were clean and changed daily, but definately on the small and thin side. No alarm clock, closet, or drawer space, but had suitcase stands, so if you can operate that way, you will be fine. This hotel is centrally located and great for the tourist on a budget or younger visitors who want to spend their money on activities rather than accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Not for this price”
Reviews.Author: CygnusX-1Bk2
Reviews.Content: No closet, no clock, no street noise insulation, skimpy thin towels, no dark curtains on the windows, community iron and ironing board at one end of the hall, only one desk attendant. Because of my "late" arrival (6 PM) I was given a suite for my first nights stay and was told I needed to move the second night. The "suite" had 3 beds, two behind a "decorated" sliding glass door. This room was on the 2nd floor and had 3 windows that opened and one that was screwed into the AC unit and was not insulated causing a draft. The bathroom window and one bedroom window opened to the roof of the building next door, if not secured intruders could easily enter. This is New York after all. The faucet for the tub and shower utilized a bare machine screw to turn on the water. The second room I was given was a shoebox compared to the suite, but the bathroom was in better condition. There was only one window in this room and it was secured to the AC unit in the same way as the suite. The were large gaps in the frame around the AC unit causing a draft and allowing all street noise to pass through. This room was on the first floor. Neither room had a clock nor a closet. The sheets seemed clean but the baseboards were dirty and the furniture was dingy. The front desk was at the end of a long hallway and only had one attendant, day or night. I had a friend in town at the same time who was in a similarly priced hotel (less expensive even) the accommodations were far more satisfactory to this place. After using Hotels.com for stays in LA and Las Vegas where I got good deals and accommodations the Manhattan Broadway Budget Hotel was an extreme let down.

Reviews.Title: “Rats in the hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cocomirai
Reviews.Content: I won't recommand this hotel, though I expect it's a budget hotel. But paying $170/night to live with rats. NO WAY! I have never expected there would be rat in a hotel room, even I've changed 2 rooms, still has it. And I know I am not the only one complaining in the hotel... Think before checking-in....

Reviews.Title: “cheap but nasty!!”
Reviews.Author: Tinarena024
Reviews.Content: Centrally located hotel but it is very shabby and the electrical wiring in the room looked positively dangerous! Rooms are absolutely tiny – if you stayed in them any length of time you felt claustorophic (I’m not usually like that!!) Towels were changed every day but they were small and very thin. The lady who owns/manages the hotel is most unpleasant - she changed the mattress in our room for no reason, to a smaller mattress which did not fit the base of the bed! She then denied that she had done this and refused to change the mattress! the staff (who the manager treats dreadfully) try their best and are most helpful and pleasant. It is a lot cheaper than other hotels in New York but unfortunately you get what you pay for!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the last few hotels in NYC thats less than $150 a night”
Reviews.Author: jasonccco
Reviews.Content: I was on a budget and had to choose this place for the price. Well, after staying there for 4 nights, i would say its well worth the money. The rooms are clean, staff's helpful, internet access in the lobby and it's close to so many major attractions.... so yea, if you dont mind a tiny lobby and a 4 person elevator, give this place a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Your typical european style hotel”
Reviews.Author: lmasonnn
Reviews.Content: The Manhattan Broadway Hotel reminds me of a little European style hotel. Small elevator, not much of a lobby, friendly staff, clean but small rooms. The rooms doesn't have much amenities, but they are quiet and clean, which was what I expected fro the price I paid. (about $150 a night, not bad at all in nyc)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly lil budget hotel It is!”
Reviews.Author: jazzjohnsom
Reviews.Content: Before entering the hotel, my friends and i were a bit worried cuz the outside really doesnt look like much. The lobby basically is the frontdesk with two internet stations for people to use. There werent anyone to help with luggage, but thank god they do have an elevator. After checkin and staying for 3 nights, we found this place to be pretty nice. It was close to a lot sightseeing places, times square, empire state building, MSG and all the b'way shows. The staff was great. They helped us locate all the places to go and even helped us get discounted tickets. We had a room with a full and a twin bed. It was clean and the maid did a pretty good job in keeping it that way for us throughout the stay. The best part is, we only paid $150 a night for the room.

Reviews.Title: “This is not even a 1 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Starseer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a joke. On hotels.com it gave pictures of the hotel with nice looking rooms and a lobby that was somewhat decent; the reality was starkly different. First of all, the hotel room did not have a closet whatsoever, there were exposed pipes in the bathroom, the whirlpool bath was broken, and all the windows were completely unfinished - spackle all over the walls in places. On TOP of that, the first night we had a RAT in our room going thru the trash (luckily we had no foodstuffs). The room's "Suite" basically was a partition in the middle of the room with a sliding glass door - not an actual wall, it didn't touch the ceiling. The only bathroom amenity they had was soap - only soap. I came to this hotel on business because the listing said "business center". Their business center was two computers on card tables in the lobby that didn't even run JAVA. I had to go to a different hotel to do my business because I couldn't log into my work email system. Avoid this hotel like the plague!!!! Paying anything more then $80 bucks a night for this dump is being overcharged!!

Reviews.Title: “RECOMMENDED!!! (if you are on a budget)”
Reviews.Author: jasonicoles
Reviews.Content: My budget was less than 200 bucks a night and I couldn't find anythign else but this place. Before I arrived, the reviews were a bit scary, but this place was quite a pleasant surprise. Small but clean rooms; Great and useful service from their front desk; the internet stations in the lobby was a life saver and the only thing I had problems with was not having enough towels, but the housekeepers were quite fast to deliver them once I requested for it. So yea, if you are on a budget like I was, this place is definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “This little place did the job for me”
Reviews.Author: houstong
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a whole week visiting friends and doing some interviews. I couldnt be more glad. Their service and location were excellent. Rooms were a bit small, but for the price i paid, $175 a night, I cant complain. The front desk people were friendly and got anything I needed right away. Room had cable TV. The bathrooms were actually nicer than some of the 3 star hotels i stayed at before. Theres a soda machine and 2 internet stations in the lobby area which were helpful to me. So I'd recommend this place for people on a budget like myself, without question

Reviews.Title: “Warning!”
Reviews.Author: roxy94
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay to this hotel was like going camping. Someone else booked this room for us. First of all we got there in the evening. We were not sure at first if we were in the right place because when the cab driver dropped us off we thought we were walking through the back door of a restaurant. We checked in took the elevator, which only held 3 small people to our room. The hall itself was so narrow two people had to take turns walking down them. Our room had no air on upon arrival, had to open the window to plug in the AC. In the room we had to take turns walking around because it was so small. We found smashed roaches on the wall, no soap, toilet lid, shampoo, no place to put toiletries in bathroom, had to ask for towels, looks to be like they had water leaks down the walls, had a dressing table but could not use it because the stool was between the table & bed and you could not pull out the stool. Make sure if you book here that your clothes are pressed unless you like ironing out in the hallway on attached to wall iron & board. NIGHTMARE!

Reviews.Title: “OK by my standards”
Reviews.Author: spooky5
Reviews.Content: This place is definitely not a BOUTIQUE hotel but a nice little budget hotel close to time square. I stayed there with my gf for 3 nights and we both were very happy with the place. Having to update my resume for interviews, the place had Internet stations to use and they even allowed me to use their fax. The rooms are tiny but clean. The maids are really thorough in cleaning all parts of the room and they gave us extra pillows for my gf's bad neck.... so overall I liked the place very much

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disgusted and Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: InTruth
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 was very apprehensive in coming to this hotel, particularly because of the varied reviews on this site. On hindsight, we should have taken heed of the advice. Lack of Space: On first impressions we were absolutely shocked, particularly as the furnishing were old-fashioned and musty, when we had requested an 'upgraded' room. In fact, we had the largest room in the hotel, which consisted of two queen sized beds and an old sagging bunker bed squeezed into one room. The only other room was taken by our suitcases, leaving no room for walking. Cleanliness/Hygiene: this was definitely most shocking. Before having even slept on the beds, we found stray hairs on the pillow cases. Feeling revolted, we had to cover our pillows with towels, and sprayed disinfectant on all the covers. There was no evidence of room service- we stayed for 2 nights and the beds were not made, nor were the sheets changed. Bathroom: the hot water was extremely difficult to adjust. It was small, cramped and once again, old. Location: This was possibly the only highlight of the hotel. It was so close to Times Square that we stayed out as late as we possibly could every night, haunting the 24hr cafe (which buy the way has the most delicious gourmet deserts that we even remember the name- "Hot n Crusty") so that we would not have to sleep in the beds. Price: the value was definitely overpriced for what it was worth. We only stayed for two nights, more out of misfortune than anything, as we had booked the rest of our stay at NY in Hotel Beacon, that was BY FAR cheaper, and what i definitely would call 4.5 star service. THERE i felt like i was on a holiday. although it was a bit further from Times Sqaure, i'd rather pay a taxi than stay uncomfortably at a cheaper place. To tell you the truth, if you are going to NY for a holiday, do yourself a favor and treat yourself. There's no point in staying in a supposedly cheaper place, which is uncomfortable and unclean, and ruining your whole stay. Enjoy the best of NY.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel's not bad, simple & really convenient!!!”
Reviews.Author: nebsmart
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the second time this year and thought of the place to be pretty good. Simple. You show your ID and pay for the room, they give u a key and the rest is all your business. The room gets cleaned everyday. There s no coffee or chocolate waiting in the room but its clean and has a phone and TV. The bathroom in this place is actually bigger and nicer than the 3-4 star hotels i ve been in. I like the place for its convenience, too. Just 2 blocks from all the time sq. subway lines. Theres a lot of places open late around it for food also. So if you are not expecting super nice service and a fansy lobby, i'd recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Run from this place!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: afrodyt2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. I just checked out this morning. I chose to stay there because I needed a hotel close to Javits Center where I took the NY bar exam. My room was about 250 sq. ft. if even but appeared clean enough, had hot water. I was about to post a 4* review for this hotel since it's crappy looking but the room was clean and the staff for the most part was fine. Well this morning I woke up at 6:40 and threw the covers back. Went to turn on the shower and when I came back in, I saw a bug crawling on the bed, when I kicked it with my flip flop I guess I squished it and the stain was a blood color. So I guess that means they were bed bugs. I saw several others crawling on the top blanket. I called the front desk and the guy that answered didn't even care about the bugs. When I went down to check out, I told the woman at the desk about the bugs and she sent the same jerk who answered the phone to check it out and of course, not five minutes later he says he didn't see anything. I tried this place because I'm strapped for cash and $200 for two nights was a stretch. I am so upset that I even stayed there, now who knows if I'll bring any of these little critters into my house!

Reviews.Title: “better of sleeping in penn station”
Reviews.Author: doringone
Reviews.Content: worst hotel i ever stayed in the beds on the floor the floor has holes in the bathroom is herendous the indows are taped with duck tape the heat didnt work the water was always cold no hot water after runnig it for 30 mins the sheets look like they never got washed there was a mouse in the room it was a total disaster and for the price i paid i got ripped off i coulda got a much better hotel for the price i dont know how they got the rating they got or arent shut down by now

Reviews.Title: “I liked this place just fine!”
Reviews.Author: michkatzzz
Reviews.Content: This place definitely is not an eye catcher from its lobby and entrance. But the room and service were just fine for me and my friends. We were checked into a pretty neat room, and we had housekeeping service everyday we stayed. There are 2 internet stations in the lobby which we accessed with our own laptops, it cost us $5 a half an hour. The staff was pretty quick to respond with anything we requested. Towels, an address to a club, cups and etc. So I'd say, if you are on a budget, this is not a bad place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “average budget hotel with decent services”
Reviews.Author: cahrlessimms
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my friends for 4 nights and we paid about $150 a night for the room. So not expecting four star hotel services, we were actually pleasantly surprised with their amenities and services. Housekeepers cleaned our room everyday, TV had cable, there was a community iron and iron board, the elevator was tiny but wored fine. The front desk people were very nice to us, sicne its our first time in new york, they were quite helpful with places to go and means of travel. I wouldnt mind recommending this hotel to others at all!

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again! For New York this is disgraceful!”
Reviews.Author: Leedek
Reviews.Content: We tried to book a hotel in New York on the cheap so we found the Manhatten Budget Hotel. Had a look at the reviews and thought that it can't possibly be that bad. Unfortunately for us it was! We booked 1 dbl room and 1 single. We got there at about 1am on Friday morning and within half an hour a "rockband" started playing next door. Apparently there is a recording studio. So after going downstairs and asking what it was and if we could change rooms they told us they'd call the Police and make a complaint about the noise. That was fine, the music soon stopped. Then it was time to have a shower. Two people staying in the room with only 1 towel provided. Through the night we wake up freezing because the heating is clearly broken. The next night when we come in we asked for an extra blanket and towels which they reluctantly supplied. Apart from the crumbs from previous guests and build up of dirt and grime, here is a list of the things that did not work in our room. * Hairdryer, * Heating, * Light shade was burnt and the light bulb had the material from the lamp shade on it. Fire hazard within itself, * The electrical sockets were taped up with ducktape and exposed wires hanging out of the wall. Then to top it all off - our room was provided with it's own private porn video! Our friend in the single room had mice or rats in the first room she was in. They moved her without replacing the snickers bar that it had chewed through. Then the room she was moved to was cockroach infested and had a "strange smell" to it. I would not recommend for anyone to stay at this hotel. Yes - it is in a good location, but I would recommend paying a bit of extra money for accommodation because it is just not worth the bad night sleep because you are parnoid the place is going to catch fire!

Reviews.Title: “Shoebox on a budget....Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: CaJules67
Reviews.Content: Well, I am going to start this review on how I first saw this hotel. I didn't see it right away, there was a small sign sticking out above two shops. There is no lobby, just a hallway with a desk built into the wall and an elevator the only fits 2 people max and barely fit our 2 bags. The first room we were given was 8x8 and had a double bed with a twin and about 4 inches of space between the 2 beds. This was unexceptable (since I had booked 2 doubles), so back downstairs I went. The second room was 8x10 and had 2 doubles with 4inches between them and about 3 feet of space between the bathroom and the end of the bed, so back downstairs I went to plead for the room in the photo(which I really don't think existed). I finally received a 12x12 room with 2 double beds and about a foot seperating them and I was soooo tired by this time that I gave in and took the room. There was a blow dryer but no towels, soap, shampoo or wash cloth and the TV was a 12in prtable put on a tv stand suspended from the corner of the room, suprisingly it had a good picture, but so does my ipod. Now, since we came to shop, we did not need a fancy place and wanted to try to save a little money. I have stayed in inexpensive hotels in New York and was pleasantly surprised. But I want to warn anyone who stays here, this hotel is below basic standards and amenities. That means there is a bed and a toilet...nothing else. I did not see any bugs in the room and the beds were comfortable, oh and you can here everything. It was not a pleasant stay, spend the extra cash and stay somewhere else. I am not a room snob by any means, but I do have some basic standards that this hotel didn't come close to meeting, plus the neighborhood made me a little uneasy, especially coming in late after a show. Go somewhere else and make it a pleasant, not a stressful time!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: frenez8198
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be called a motel, the night staff is very rude, the room is small, not only the t.v. was small it was on a board attached on the wall it was so high they had a wooden ladder to reach it you couldn't even see the t.v from the bed!! there was rouches in the room the bed smelled really bad,the windows had duck tape around them,the wonderful view of a brick wall, the a.c. in the room was being held up by clothes on top of not working i went to the front desk and they said to open a window they refuse to change me rooms never in my life have i seen something like that !!! this hotel makes a hostel look like a five star hotel !!!! STAY AWAY !!!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: nenamexiqueen
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Manhattan Broadway Hotel was an experience that I would hope no one else will put themselves through. I room wasn't clean, there were no carpeting on the hallway floors, you could hear everything from other rooms around you and also from the hall. It sounded as though people were beating drums all night long. The staff didn't know if they had rented the room out or not so they used their key to walk in on us. The front desk staff was having an argument with a patron because he paid for 5 hrs of usage of a room and didn't use the full 5 hrs and he wanted the rest of his money back. i won't recommend this hotel for anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: liesde
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst hotel I ever stayed in. The room was dull and cramped. The sheets were dirty and the walls stained. The staff entered our room while we were out shopping and moved us to another room. The packed our belongings in bags and moved us from two to one claiming there was a plumming problem but I demanded to see our old room to discover it was already let to new people. We had to call the police to sort the problem out he said it was a bad hotel and we should not have been there. Then on our last night I was confronted by a huge mouse in the lobby!!! The hotel manager was abusive and hung up the phone when we complained. Don't stay here. Lisa

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time”
Reviews.Author: Iaminlovewithny
Reviews.Content: I had a Wonderful time in newyork and at the hotel. The staff was amazing and great help.I am actually gonna be coming back in nov and Im hoping to stay the manhatten again.

Reviews.Title: “it was OK”
Reviews.Author: guilloponko
Reviews.Content: we stayed 5 nights,clean,hot water,small room though, the elevator is really small. No cockroackes at all, we got our beds made everyday. The only thing that bother me was that they turned off the AC when they came to do the beds and 1 of the staff was rude but it really wasnt that bad for $125 a night

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed two night at Manhattan Broadway. I didn't exected Hayatt quality for this price (we paid $280 CAD for 2 night, 2 adaults) and I was right. But we were in room no more that 6 hours during the night and we had comfortable bed, clean bathroom, a lot of towels, air comditioner, hot water, great location, receptionists were nice and helpful. But I'm not picky andif you are you have to pay more and go somewhere else ( I prefer spend extra money for shopping!)

Reviews.Title: “Okay but it could of been better.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well my friends and i stayed there the other weekend, and it was actually okay. Once we got there, the service was a little slow beacuse we had to wait for our room to be tidy up. When we got to our room, I thought it was going to be really bad, but it was actually decent. One part about the room itself was wrong, it had said 1 double and 1single, but they end up giving us a double but with bunk beds included. The bathroom was good, running water, towels, and pretty clean. The floors could of been in better shape but we didn't mind. Our room was a tad bit small but we didn't care cause we werent' there to stay in the hotel overall. When we needed help with our room, the staff was quick to come too. Overall, the location is the best part about this hotel cause you're seconds away from time square, and all the attractions. I would recommend this hotel to some friends but only if they're there to go out not to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Disgusting Hotel Imaginable”
Reviews.Author: amywynn217
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Oct of 99. We booked through Hotels and it was a steal at $150 a night. Had we but known. All I can say is this place should rent by 15 minute increments if you get my drift. The hotel was beyond filthy and there were q-tips stuck to the headboards, some unknown bodily fluids on the bathroom tile. The TV's didn't work, there was no hot water, and the heater didn't work. The rooms were so small you'd have to go outside to change your mind. Our room wasn't clean when we got there, we all slept on top of the bedsheets in our clothes...luckily my sister brought a few pillow cases. We spent all evening trying to find another hotel so we wouldn't have to stay there. The benches at Penn Station, just down the street, were looking so inviting. We finally found the next morning the Howard Johnson on 8th. This place should be condemed.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad! Nice friendly little place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was suitable for my stay. My friend and I got a room with 2 seprate beds, stayed here for 3 nights and had no problem. The rooms were clean and we got housekeeping service everyday. Ask for cups and additional towels @ the front desk, they dont give you enough sometimes. The staff's very nice and helpful. Stay here if you are on a budget and need to be around time square or penn station.

Reviews.Title: “typicall budget hotel in a big city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: for the price of this hotel it is great, amazing location, 5 mins walk from times square, 5 mins from empire state or madison sq gardens so great location, but yes it is shabby, i found it shabby not dirty, the bathroom was not bad was clean and all worked and thats all that i needed!! I would say this is not suitable for families but anyone coming to new york wanting just to sight see, perfect for backpackers its a backpackers dream, if your looking for a nicer hotel for a bit more cash check out the pennslyvanian oppsite madison sq gardens, but if u dont care or are short of cash and want to be in the middle of the city check this on out, oh and dont be afraid by all the adult shops in the area it doesnt bring in doggy people

Reviews.Title: “Good value, perfect for my 3 day trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and cost under $500....which i didnt find in midtown manhattan anywhere else. The staff was great and helpful. Rooms had their own bathrooms with tub. They were cleaned everyday. this hotel did the job and I'd recommend it to anyone whos on a budget and is looking for a good location.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews I really expected the "Roach Motel". I was pleasantly surprised. It felt a bit like a college dorm room - not a lot of space. NO bugs (I watched Primetime - I looked for bed bugs!), no mice, or any other creature. Convenient short walk to Times Square. Staff was very nice and made good recommendations on where to eat. If you are going to NYC to see NYC and not hang out in your hotel room. This is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “We smelt like woks!”
Reviews.Author: blockislandgirl
Reviews.Content: Figures the only time I didn't read the reviews! I first words out of my mouth was "Is my reservation refundable?" The lobby is 3 feet wide, interent cafe- is that a joke! It was late and not refundable. My friends and I loved the sliding glass half wall in the middle of the room with mirror decals- very trippy! We won't eat chinese for a long time considering the room smelt like a wok! We ran out of toliet paper at 6 am but be ready go to the lobby and get it yourself! Book your trip early and spend the extra $$- scary place!

Reviews.Title: “Super Convenient, stayed here twice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is not a 3 star hotel, so dont expect to walk into a fancy lobby with bellmen helping you with luggage or shopping bags. This is my second trip to new york, first time was for business, now to watch the big east finals. The hotel's only 4 bblocks away from Madison Square Garden and 4 blocks (in the other direction) to Time Square. The room was quite clean, but small. The bathroom is actually pretty spacious, bigger than some of the 3 star hotels i've been in. For the price I paid, a bit more than $100 per night, I thought it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “customer service was a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: coifguru
Reviews.Content: We used Hotels to find a newyorkcity hotel. when we arrived it was like a bowery flop house! I had my children with me and we had to get two rooms and they werent even next to each other. There were broken bottles in the hall and pubic hairs in the bed. this was the broadwaymanhattan hotel. we were going to see a show and wanted to walk in the theater district. I couldnt stay there with my family, so we had to get another room at the hilton, which cost us 400. for the night, plus the 200 that was non refundable from the other place! We contacted Hotels that we booked through and they took no responsibility and wouldnt even discuss what we had found at this hotel that gets 2 stars on their site! Beware of the catchy Hotels commercials, we learned the hard way.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Horrible, dirty and terribly small....I am telling you.....you cant even imagine. For a few dollars more a night....let me tell you, you can find alot better. Please dont even bother to try it out a night....Its like a horror house. Really disgusting place....cant understand why they are still open. Take my word for it. You should try the QT hotel on 45th....extremely nice boutique hotel....people are exceptionnally nice. Mylene and Rob from Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy rat hole”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't have words to describe this place. I can't even belive this can be considered a hotel. The Health Department should close that hovel. It is the filthiest place I've ever been in my life and believe me, I was in many third-world countries. Rats squeaking in the alley, a horrible smell, the bathroom was disgusting, no closet, hairs everywhere, noisy... and a Chinese manager screaming at guests. Go somewhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Looking back now, we laugh and laugh.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm having a hard time choosing between TERRIBLE and EXCELLENT. This hotel truly was awful, but it gave me some excellent memories and a great experience in New York City. We stayed here a few years back now, and the only reason I'm writing my review now, is because it's late at night and me and my fiancee are laughing our heads off reading the other reviews of this hotel, after a conversation reminiscing on one great vacation we took. After reading these reviews, I can only imagine it has gotten worse in the last few years, but here's my story. My fiancee and I, along with two of our best friends arrived in NYC. It was in the middle of one of the worst heat waves on record, and we were in our early twenties and loose in Manhattan. This hotel is where we made our homebase. At the time, it only cost $100 per night, and we crammed all four of us into one room. We arrived, and walked into the single door, down the dirty narrow hallway to the "lobby" which is well described by other reviewers so I'll spare you the redundancy. Except for the fact that there was an eldery guest in the lobby who told us to leave now, and go stay somewhere else. We didnt listen. The elevator is tiny, and we all barely fit, but we made our way up to the fourth floor where our room was. (We never took the elevator a second time.) The deadbolt on our door didnt fit into the hole in the door frame, so we called down to the front. They told us someone would be right up...and they were. Some dude arrived right away, cigarette dangling from his mouth, and grinder in hand. He proceeded to grind away at our door frame, without any safety goggles at all, and without taking the cigarette out of his mouth, and the sparks were flying and bouncing all over the curtains and carpet. But hey, then the deadbolt worked. So, I mentioned we were on the 4th floor, and there are only 5 floors in the hotel. But, the fifth floor was closed for construction, which meant the staircase had a blanket taped up blocking its way....Not enough to stop a few adventurous twenty-somethings, to be sure. We boldly went behind the blanket, and ventured up the stairs to see what secrets the fifth floor held. When we got to the top of the stairs, we found a doorway to the roof. And I mean a doorWAY...no door was attached. So out we went. The roof had lots of great stuff on it, like toilets, bricks, and believe it or not... A REAL SIGN for the hotel! A nice big one, just lying there. Anyways, so we went back to our room, and like i said it was so damn hot we all had to take showers at least twice a day. So we go into the shower, and realize there's a curtain on the wall inside the bathtub. We pulled back the curtain, and revealed a nice big WINDOW. In the shower. Looking out into the alley where the band rehearses. During the day, when we went out sightseeing, the staff would sneak into our room and turn off our air conditioner. They did this everyday, even after we asked them to stop. Oh, one last thing...when we we're out late, and returning for the night, one night there was some dude urinating on the door of the hotel, so we waited for him to finish, then we rang the buzzer to be let in the front door. The guy manning the desk came, opened the door for us, nervously scanned the empty street, and hurried us inside, locking the door behind us. In summary, we had a great time, and now we have a great story, but we did spend the last couple nights of our Manhattan stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Roach Motel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was awful. Period. At first we though, oh this is not so bad, but as soon as we got on the bunk beds, we realize they are just foam pads under a 1 inch mattres. All you will feel is metal supports if you go to sleep there. Also, on my "clean sheets" there were pubic hairs!! Yes i know this sounds odd, but I literally slept in a Tyvec suit because i was so disgusted. Anyway, as we wake up at 5 am, what do we find? ROACHES running around our stuff... We let the person at the front desk know how we felt and about the cocaroches, but he of course could have cared less. Needsless to say, you should stay away!!!

Reviews.Title: “Freezing in the City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because 6 girls were on a shopping trip and moved from another not-so-friendly NYC hotel because of the # of people. Anyway - the MB would accomodate 6 to a room. Luckily we had an air mattress with us (remember - we were here to shop!). One of the beds was a broken futon thingy, and the other 2 beds had linens that came from a charity organization. The bathroom was disgusting with a horrible blue light. It was December and snowy, and the heat didn't work - one of those old boiler heaters. They had to come and tape blankets around the windows to keep the cold out. We slept in our coats, gloves, scarves, you name it, we used it for warmth. The maids cart is a shopping cart mind you. And the elevator is the scariest thing ever. Needless to say, we really slummed it and would gladly pay a little more for a nicer hotel the next time we hit the Big Apple. Enter at your own risk!!

Reviews.Title: “Unsanitary and Unsafe”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have never felt compelled to write a hotel review or any other review for that matter until now because I was so completely sickened by my experience at Manhattan Broadway Hotel. I've travelled and stayed in $8/night hostels in Prague, etc. and I have NEVER seen such disgusting conditions as I did at Manhattan Broadway. There were about 10 pubic hairs in the bed, brown stains all over the toilet, the phone had no dial pad and was barely intact, and the men directly outside the room were hissing sexually at me and smoking. Unless you are travelling with someone who wouldn't mind taking shifts throughout the night to keep watch for these sketchy neighbors and who wouldn't mind mining the bed for pubic hair, I'd pay the extra $40 and go to The New Yorker hotel at 34th and 8th. When I tried to cancel the room, John at the front desk barely put down his food to listen to me and then informed me that I'd have to pay anyway. While the cancellation policy requires 24 hours notice, there was no possible way for me to know that the hotel would ever offer such deplorable conditions to its customers. John was extremely rude, slamming his clipboard and raising his voice, "What part of this don't you understand?" I almost had to laugh with the other shocked customers because it felt like a bad clip from Saturday Night Live. I honestly hope none of you make the same mistake I did.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed here 3 times!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've actually stayed at this hotel 3 times, planning on a fourth stay soon. Yes, it's very small. You generally have to crawl over the bed to get to the bathroom. But it's clean, and you absolutely can't get a better location(about 2 blocks from port autority,allowing you to get on the subway to anywhere you want to go.) You do have to have a bit of an adventurous nature to stay here. There are no amenitites at all, staff can be helpful, but not always. But you do get your own bathroom, and other hotels at similar prices make you share bathrooms. Overall, if you want a cheap place to sleep, that's clean and safe, and you are not picky, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury may not be on the menu but....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for as cheap as it gets, this hotel is for you. I've noticed some of the reviews of this place have been less than favourable, however you pay for what you get; basic rooms and basic service that does the job. Besides, the location is good and it gives you a better feel for NYC than, say, staying in a five star. That said, should you have the cash, don't scrimp! Get your lolly out for the five star everytime!

Reviews.Title: “Small, but accomodating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read the other reviews for this hotel the day before leaving for NYC. I was quite afraid! Once I arrived, I noticed the drab exterior of the hotel. The lobby was not very much more inviting, but the staff were helpful and accomdating. My family had originally reserved two rooms, but the hotel was overbooked so they changed us to the Grand Suite (still extremely small by any standards). This is a no frills hotel, but you are walking distance from Times Square and in the heart of the Garment District. The location is prime. It reminded me of a small European hotel - small, clean, just the basics. You are paying for location, not luxury here. We heard the band playing but they usually stopped around midnight (it is NYC, so you probably won't be in your room until then anyway!).

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As soon as you enter this grubby hotel your heart sinks. The only elevator can hold one person and a case. The whole hotel smells of bleach. My double room was aprox nine feet by nine feet - no window, heater hanging off wall (no AC), lights did not work, no bedcovers just dirty looking blankets. Try to complain and the staff lose their ability to speak English! No matter how Cheap this hotel appears it is just disgusting. No 'phone no coffer/tea facilities in rooms (no room in rooms in any case). Certainly absolutely nothing like their pictures!! Even the road on which it is situated looks menancing after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - that was weird”
Reviews.Author: ambrva1
Reviews.Content: I am having a hard time even reveiwing this hotel. It was such a strange experience. The room itself was clean and the front desk staff were actually very nice. We only stayed for one night, so it was an amusing experience as opposed to a horrifying one. If we had to stay more than one or two nights it probably would have been awful. The room was large enough for a bed and a walkway into the bathroom. Literally the bed was flush against 3 walls of the room so that we had to crawl over eachother to get out of bed. In the bedroom (really in the walkway to the bathroom) was a small window with a window unit air conditioner in it. There was a black curtain with yellow and pink flowers on it over that window. The bathroom was almost as large as the room itself. (A friend of mine has a really large SUV and I think the bedroom was smaller than her car.) The bathroom also had a window, and that had a curtain that had the earth toned abstract kind of curtain that was popular in cheap hotels in the 70's. The shower curtain was blue and had drawings of dogs all over it. (Not that people had vandalized the shower curtain, it looked relatively new; the shower curtain was meant to have drawings of dogs all over it.) The bathtub itself looked deep and as tho it had once been nice. It looked like at one time jacuzzi jets had been present, but had now been caulked over. All that being said, the bed itself was very comfortable and the room was clean. There did not seem to be destitute people there, just confused ones like us that accidently reserved a room there. (I left the reservations up to others, and by time I checked out the hotel we had to stay at least one night or be charged anyway, I moved us to the Carlton on Madison Ave the following night. Otherwise we would have been there seven nights!!) I would say that if you had a long layover in NYC, a sense of humor, and needed a cheap place to stay in Manhattan, it might be worth it. More than one night would probably be a bit of a stretch tho.

Reviews.Title: “The worst of the WORST!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would not stay here even if they pay me. The WORST hotel at which I've ever stayed. It's 10 times worse than what you can possibly imagine of a bad hotel. It's so very nasty. I couldn't stand it even with my eyes closed.

Reviews.Title: “subpar hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from NYC, hotel had its pros and cons. Pros: Hotel is cheap, economical and fairly good for the price. Very close to everything, just a couple of blocks (<5min walk to Timesquare), 1 block from grays papaya (mmmmMMM). Close to subway, pretty much all trains. Cons: Service is very minimal. At check-in they gave us the wrong room (single bed) which was uncleaned and recently used by "adults", empty wrappers on the floor. Luckly, after we told them that the room was wrong, they changed us to the correct one. The rooms themselves are decent, fair considering the price. Washrooms are clean. Room airconditioners are finicky, sometimes work and sometimes don't. When we complained that the airconditioners didn't work, the manager got very angry and threatened to kick us out. Not really sure why, maybe because it was late? The nightshift worker had to call the manager at around 11:30pm. Overall: We wouldn't not stay here again, but pretty good for students or those that do not mind a more the "run-down" feel.

Reviews.Title: “I had a totally different experience here from the ones described.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was naturally a little perturbed by the other reviews about this hotel and my prejudices were given more credence when I saw our hotel lobby was effectively a door between a Chinese restaurant and an internet café. However, there was an extremely friendly and pretty girl in reception who upgraded us to a 3 bedroom suite (between two of us) and gave us all the information we needed about Manhattan. Our room was very spacious with a glass divider in the middle allowing a couple of blokes a bit of privacy and distance from each other and I think we paid about 60 dollars between us for it. The bathroom was fine, I don't remember any particularly noxious smells and the only problem was the slightly rusty windows. It is in a great area, extremely cheap and although I can see how one more accustomed to smug grandeur wouldn't enjoy their stay here I found it better than suitable. Perhaps it would have been a different review if the room had been a box with a bunkbed and shared bathrooms (as we had at the Pickwick Arms hotel) but it was a large enough room to chill out in and not be on top of one another and actually bigger than 4* hotels I've visited. I've stayed at many hotels and this is the only one I've ever been sufficiantly motivated to write a positive review for. I can't guarentee you'll enjoy your stay here, but my own experience was far better than the others I've seen described.

Reviews.Title: “Bad place and not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: Pinaris
Reviews.Content: It is overprice, i would not go back there again, it was very depressing hotel. I also had a bad experience about parking, i checked out and went for a walk and went to get a car at the parking service then come back to get a luggage at hotel real fast, park in front of hotel not even 30 seconds to get the luggage, the police gave me the parking ticket cost $115. I did explain to the police that i did not even want to park there, just would like to get luggage, the taxi even stops to get passenger longer than i was. This hotel is not convenient at all, i used to stay at other hotels about the same price and was impressed a lot more than this place, never had any problems about parking with other hotels before. Bad place, very depressing, not worth the money, and bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Was not happy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel after reviewing the Hotel on the internet, we called the hotel and they sounded very freindly and helpful. We checked into the hotel and it was very tiny, not enough to fit 3 adults in the room. The bathroom was filty, not a good smell and furniture were mismatched and blocking switch to bathroom. I didnt' dare sit on the bed or stay in the room. We tried to look up nearby hotels/motels but all the yellow pages were torn out, thankfully we had cell phones to call 411. We decided on Waldorf Astoria which was okay but far better then where we almost stayed.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever, backpacker hostels are much better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was NOT nice!! I've just asked how to go to the statue of liberty, he just gave me a piece of paper wrote down (found out later) subway no. and not telling me anything what he wrote and his face trying to say that I'm busy go away!! The room was terrible I've ever seen. You will NOT GET ANY SLEEP if you stay here as you will hear everything from outside and the other rooms. I've been to many backpacker hostels around Australia, New Zealand and I would say they are much better than this dump hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is a Dump!!! Over Priced Hostile!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, cancel your reservation now. We paid $209.00 to stay in a roach motel/hostile. I stayed at the Manhattan Broadway Hotel just this past weekend, April 16 for one night. We arrrived at the hotel which was difficult to find because the sign is a piece of paper above the door. Entrance is a long beat up hallway. Front Desk is a mess. Internet station is a joke. 2 computers set up on card tables several inches away from the desk. Front Desk area smelled of the chinese food next door and sewage. Narrow steps. I slipped going down several steps. The metal guard on the step was loose and had not been fixed yet. Elevator is a scare. Fits one person and a bag, two is tight. We entered our room on the third floor to find two twin beds pushed together to make a king. Room was literally the size of the closet. Carpeting tore up and looked stained though it was vaccuumed. Had a window but it was blocked for some reason. Air conditioner in the wall which only blew the air around never cooled the room. Sheets and comforter did not match. Comforter was dirty. The matress did not have the proper sheets on it. No alarm clock, no iron, no ironning board. The phone was missing buttons. Brown Finger smudges all around the cheap molding of the room and on both sides of the bathroom door, tv, and remote. Furniture looked beat up and ready for the curb. TV mounted to the wall but facing the opposite direction of the bed. Bathroom was small. Tub facet missing. We turned it on and off with a long screw. Bath towels, the size of a washcloth. Cheap and Dirty. Staff seem friendly but run a dumpy hotel. Also not located exactly where they claim. Friends of ours stayed in a suite the same night. The suite was in the same condiditon as our king room. We asked for some extra blankets and what the staff provided smelled of mildew.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price, but not if you are too touchy”
Reviews.Author: vikingtraveller07
Reviews.Content: I admit: the photos on the web look better than the rooms themselves (except for the bathroom, which was exactly like on the photograph), the room was very small, and it's not a luxury hotel. But on the other side: very nice and clean bathroom, nice and helpful staff, right at the corner of 8th Avenue, almost ten subway lines and several buses in a few blocks' distance, two post offices, three Starbucks and several breakfast places in close walking distance, close to Times Square, Macy's, Penn Station and Empire State Building, and a great price. You can get hotel rooms in New York for a comparable price, but not in this location. We enjoyed our stay and would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!! ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Please read all the reviews that is shown for this hotel, 99,99 % reallity. Me and my family is willing to fill in all the citical reviews for this dump. Nothing works. Non working TV No Clean Towels No heat or AC No clean bed sheets No vaccumed floors for the latest years. It was the most horrible dump to stay in, even to try to sleep in. We stayed for two nights and belive us, pigs in Sweden has better and cleaner place to live in and this DUMP called Hotel Mannhattan Broadway. Our wishes for your best "DONT STAY AT THIS DUMP"

Reviews.Title: “What the hell”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What the hell was the first thing we all said when we saw the hotel from outside. It didn't look at all as the picture we saw on Hotels. When they say that they're hotel sign is a A4 paper on the door written Hotel: it's so true. The "Lobby" is a tight hallway that includes the "Internet Cafe" which consists of a vending machine and a PC on a table in front of the "Front Desk". The smell was horrible to bear. The "elevator" is literally a shoe box that where u pray you’ll make it to your floor safely. The room was tiny and filthy!!!! We asked for clean towels we got them full of YELLOWISH and RED (blood) STAINS. The bed sheets were full of HAIR, WHOLES and STAINS as well. I don't know how we made it through the first night. We had booked what they call a "suite". The third bed was a BROKEN couch hard as a rock and again full of HAIR and STAINS so we were 5 to squeeze in 2 beds. We felt so DIRTY we had to walk around with our shoes on and USE OUR OLD T-SHIRTS AS PILLOW CASES, that's how filthy it was. The next morning one of us woke up to realize he had SLEPT ALL NIGHT ON A CONDOM WRAPPER!!!! God knows what else was under the sheets. We went down to complain again and they told us that the room will be clean as soon as the cleaning lady would come in at 9:30 AM. We went out looking for another hotel, when we came back at 12:30 in the afternoon the room was as is!!!!! The neighbourhood was one of the worst. We understand the low budget, "only there to sleep" arguments but the hotel doesn't even meet the lowest liveable standards, the car would have been better. The hotel is good for no human being, not students nor singles. For the same price or a bit higher you could easily find a cleaner hotel with even a better view and near to everything as well. Please Please Please believe this review, if not the other ones the THE MANHATTAN BROADWAY is not a hotel but a disgrace to garbage cans. We ended up getting a full refund and checked in a bigger, cleaner hotel, with an amazing view all for an extra 100$ to the total.

Reviews.Title: “this is a dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This message is coming out of Greenville N.C. Istayed at this hotel on March 5th. It was very nasty. The blankets and sheets were discusting. We had to call and ask them to give us some heat in 20 degree weather. We had no way of cutting the heat on ourselves. The shower curtain had mildew stains all over it. You could have died from the thick dust on the furniture. This hotel needs to be shut down. Hotel needs to take this off their list.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Bad as the Previous Reviews”
Reviews.Author: HonestJohn
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for! OK - I have stayed at the Sherry-Netherlands and The Plaza and NO this ain't The Plaza. But it is not nearly as bad as previously described. My fiance stayed with me and she is very fussy and she found no fault with this place either. It is hard to find, I missed it the first time, look for the sign that says INTERNET CAFE. The front desk staff was nice. The neighborhood is borderline, walk towards SEVENTH AVE NOT Eighth. The elevator is tiny, after me and my 99 lb fiance got in, there was barely enough room for 2 shoeboxes, certainly not enough room to swing a cat. The room was small, the linens were clean and decent. The TV worked, the bathroom was as described and the shower worked fine with plenty hot water for 2. Towels were clean, soap NO shampoo. No face clothes, no big deal. We went out to dinner and the theater and returned to find all our possesions in place and no one had tampered in anyway. There were NO signs of vermin, no roaches, etc. Not the best hotel in Manhattan, but certainly NOT the bucket of blood so many others here have described. I would be glad to go back if I could get the same low rate that I got on this stay ($74 w/ Tax) Once again, you get what you pay for, and this place is dirt cheap for NYC standards.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend, her parents and I wanted to be able to go to New York and have a good time, but when we all saw this hotel, we knew what a dump it was. Just that the fact that there is a piece of paper taped to the door to tell you that this is a hotel should give you an idea about how bad it really is...No room, screws for sink handles, clogged bathtub drain. The TV didn't work, there was no VCR, you could hear everything that was going on in the rooms around you. The elevator smelled horrible and the curtains didn't even keep out the light. Lastly, there were no dressers, just hangers and hooks, that's it! Yes, the hotel IS located close to times square but is it worth it to stay somewhere that is totally disgusting just to be close to times square?

Reviews.Title: “scary first impression but did the job”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in december... when we arrived at the hotel, i got a bit of a fright, the sign for the hotel was just stuck on the door by celotape and it was just a sheet of A4 paper.... we walked up the dingy hall and checked in. we then went over to the lift (that always smelt really bad), we had to take turns to take the lift because it was so small. we arrived at the door of our room, we were very hesitant about what we would find because i had read the reviews of this hotel before and lets just say i am the biggest wimp when it comes to any kind of spiders, especially cockroaches..... the room was tiny and barely enough room for our suitcases, but it was clean and tidy and it basically did the job. my friends and i did not have high expectations of this hotel for the price we paid for it, all we wanted was a nice, clean and warm room to drop off the shopping bags and to sleep in..... thats exactly what we got.... the location couldn't be better, it is halfway between herald square(with macys and all the good shops) and times sqaure, and it is literally about 30 seconds from port authority... if all your looking for, is a clean room and a perfect location, then this is the place for you....

Reviews.Title: “This is the worst hotel ever!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ribsam
Reviews.Content: We lasted 5 minutes in the first room they showed us, between the fingerprints all over the wall of mirrors, the dirty sheets (there was no comforter) or the gross bathroom. I would not even sit on the bed it was that bad. the thought of laying on it almost made me vomit. They then offered us an "upgrade". It was bigger but the bathroom wasn't even cleaned yet from the last people. So my sister sat on one of the beds while we waited for someone to come and clean it. When she sat down on it something ran out from under it to under the bunkbeds that were tucked in this tunnel-like-area built into the corner of the room. We couldn't tell what it was because it moved too quickly. They did give us a full refund when we RAN back to the fromt desk and informed them there was absolutely no way we would be staying. Avoid this hotel at all cost!! Any positive review for this dump would have to come from the person who owns it. But, then again it is so dirty I am sure they wouldn't even sleep there!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room at the Manhattan Broadway for 7 nights, but when I got there, I was horrified. As soon as I saw my room, I wanted to get out of there. The room had a queen sized bed and a twin bed and they were pushed together. The beds didn't have headboards and the "closet" consisted of 3 broken coat hangers. My view was of a dark and dirty alley. The "internet cafe" was a flimsy table with a laptop on it and a broken soda machine. I could barely squeeze into the elevator and walk through the hallway because it was such a tight space. I immediately checked out of there as soon as I arrived and stayed in a wonderful hotel a few blocks away for the remainder of my trip. I had to pay a few hundred extra for that other hotel, but it was definately worth it. This hotel is truly a dump. Someone should tear that place down. DO NOT STAY AT THE MANHATTAN BROADWAY EVER EVER EVER!!

Reviews.Title: “So bad it was funny...as if it were dump hotel in a movie.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For my trip to NYC for new years we could not find a room for the 31st and the 1st so we were forced to find a new hotel for the 1st. Upon reviewing it on Hotels we decided it was decent enough for the night. We booked 2 rooms and arrived on the 1st and checked in. We thought the place was a joke. We looked at our first room and we couldn’t even walk into the room. the room was so small that the beds were touching to make one HUGE bed. There were stains on everything and the lights were dim and scary. There was an extension cord hanging from the ceiling in the bathroom and there were tacky mirrors everywhere. We said no way! The second room was much better but a far cry from livable. We went down stairs and told them that we needed another room. They didn’t have on available at that time but said they would in the afternoon. When we returned the man at the desk said he had upgraded us to a suite. We had to contain our laughter (What does a suite look like in this hell hole). When we left the tin can of an elevator we entered a hallway that smelled of vomit! We walked into our suite and found a makeshift wall with a clear sliding glass door separating the rooms. The view we had out our window was of an adult video and sex shop. Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Oriented Midtown experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I both have years of management experience in the luxury resort industry. We know and enjoy luxury but when we travel we are frugal. We sleep, shower, etc. in a hotel room. Our trip is NOT the hotel. The Manhattan Broadway Hotel provided a comfortable, clean bed in a very small room. The large bathroom had a marble floor, full tub with shower, and was very clean (as was the entire property). The elevator was very small but large enough and quite typical of older New York properties. Best of all we were only about 100 feet from 8th and a short walk to 7th. Our trip was great and the Manhattan Broadway Hotel left us with money to spend on shows, restaurants and other activities.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!!! Website is a fraud!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wish Hotels would take this DUMP off it's list of hotels to choose from. The website is a total fraud. Garbage in the halls, narrow dark halls on the way to a small, dark, old, cramped room stuffed with 4 beds they called a "suite". The curtains did not cover the windows! I asked to see the rooms that appear on the Website and they could not show me. I was shocked! I immediately checked out of this $400/night hotel and into the $279/night luxurious Hyatt at Grand Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away! Stay away! Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I travel frequently on business, and have for well over 20 years. I ended up staying here last week because I failed to account for the NYC Christmas crowds, and was unable to get a room at one of the places at which I usually stay. Every negative review you read here is 100% right on! Anything positive you read here is inaccurate and misleading. (I must note though that the hotel staff themselves were all friendly and tried their best to be accomodating. They simply don't have much to work with here.) The simple fact is that this hotel should not be allowed to operate as is. I have stayed in many, many different places all over the world, and have never experienced anything as bad as this. Like a couple of the other reviewers, I too merely needed a place to sleep, and wasn't overly concerned about the lack of amenities. (The last I heard however, "cleanliness" and "sanitary" weren't considered "amenities".) There are far too many things wrong with this place to list, but I'll try. It is unclean - and I mean everything. The entrance, lobby (if you can call it that), the shoebox sized elevator, the hallways, the room (and every single thing in it), and the bathroom. The sheets were threadbare and did not appear or smell clean, there were clumps of hair on the pillows which certainly weren't mine. (It was to the point that I wondered if they rented these rooms out by the hour during the day, when most of the patrons were either working or out sightseeing.) The walls and ceiling were badly stained. The carpeting almost defies description - filthy indoor/outdoor carpeting, which kind of "crackled" when you walked on it, and which was cut out around the bed and dresser, as though whoever put it in was too lazy to move the furniture first. The mattress was as hard as a rock, and also provided that lovely "crackling" sound when you sat in it. (My therapist has advised me that it would be in my best interest to try to forget the details of the "comforter" on top of the bed.) The bathroom lterally had piles of debris/hair/ etc... in each corner. I wanted to wear my shoes in the tub, never mind even considering taking a bath in it. No shampoo was provided of course. I am thankful that it wasn't summertime, because I have no doubt that the place would be chock full of bugs, cockroaches, and who knows what else. I had to scrub the dresser drawers before I put my clothing in them. I lined them with plastic bags as well. Let's see, none of the windows were openable, there were noisy, inconsiderate people coming and going all night long - up and down the 5 foot wide hallways, making no effort whatsoever to try to be quiet. The neighborhood, although not the best/safest, and certainly not what you are led to expect (by hotels or Expedia) by any stretch of the imagination, wasn't terrible, and was convenient to Times Square and the Theater District. The TV got about 20 channels - of these, 3 were in Spanish, 3 were Oriental, and most of the balance didn't come in well enough to either watch or listen to. From the outside, this hotel bears absolutely no resemblance to the picturesque little brownstone you see on the Internet. It is a squat, drab little place, with the word "Hotel" handwritten on the back of a sheet of printer paper, taped to the door. (There were some sort of dead, skinned fowl (I think they were ducks) hanging in the window immediately to the left of the entrance. There is also apparently a place very nearby that has been rented to a fledgling rock band (and trust me, they are very early on in their careers), which is used for their nightly practice session, which thankfully seemed to wrap up at about 10:30 PM. It is also billed as an "Internet Cafe". This portion of their business consisted of two computers on TV trays (or something similar) in the already crowded lobby. I didn't see anything that would render the term "Cafe" an appropriate name for the business. When I returned home, I washed everything, whether I had worn it or not, and brought my suits and ties to the dry cleaners. (I neglected to mention that there wasn't a closet in my room - I was forced to hang all of my clothes on the wall-mounted clothes rod, for all the world to see while the maid was "cleaning??" my room.) I should also mention that this is the second room I had here - I was in the first one for about 30 seconds before I was on the (dirty, sticky) phone calling the front desk insisting on a different room. They were equally disgusting, but at least in the second room, I was able to get into the bathroom without the need to sandwich myself against the filthy wall and slide sideways into it. (I am not a big person either - 5'8" and 155 lbs). As for climate controls - there was no lack of heat, in fact there was no controlling the heat. It was stifling all night long. I peeled off the "comforter" and "blanket" and just slept with the dirty sheet. (Even now I shudder at the recollection.) I am most surprised that this was listed as a halfway decent place on Hotels. In fact, the only reason I remained here was due to the fact that as I had booked the room on hotels, I had already paid for it. I sensed that if I mentioned anything about a refund to the person at the front desk, I would have been laughed out into the street. (Which in itself would have been an upgrade.) The room was not inexpensive - $109/night for the first few nights and then $149/night for the final night. The bottom line is that people should not be expected to shell out that kind of money and then end up in a place like this. If this is the new baseline for price/value in NYC, then shame on the hotel industry. My advice would be to either plan your trip well in advance, and you absolutely can get a decent room in this price range (or even for slightly less) in the city, albeit with a little advance planning; or as an alternative, simply budget a little more for this expense. If you can't afford to spend a little more, you would be well-advised to postpone your trip untilyou can. As for me, I will never, ever stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “THE ABSOLUTE WORST !!! STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There can't be a more awful hotel in NYC. Do not be deceived by the internet pictures. We got tricked and it almost ruined my marriage. WAY too expensive for what you get. Stains on ceilings and floors, dirty bathrooms, and scenic views out your windows of trashy roof tops. However, the management are very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is filthy, cocroach ridden and the showers / bath was non functional Someone in America tried to used my credit card on the web to buy things from sears and myfamily, the day before I got to America. Fortunately my credit card was password protected for web use so the transactions failed. However the only people I know in America that had my credit card details at this time was the Manhattan Broadway Hotel, so not only are they liars but thieves as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The first night i got there i was suprised at how small our room was; there was hardly room to move in the room. The sheets had stains on them, and the bed was suppose to be for two but barely fit one. The staff was nice enough to "upgrade" us to a bigger room. this room was definetly nicer, and presented us with more room. The only problem was the mattresses were as hard as a board. Sleeping was practically impossible. The next time i stay in new york i will look for a little longer and probably choose a chain hotel, so i know it has creditiblity.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Manhattan Broadway Dump!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was the most HORRIBLE HOTEL I have ever seen. The day I was to leave for NYC I phoned Hotels and asked them if they could find me a place for the next two days. I told them how many people etc. Well they told me that they had a place called the Manhattan Broadway and that I could get a suite in NYC for $289.00 a night. I said that sounded ok and they said that they would book it for me. I never requested it, I had no idea about what it was like. Upon reaching NYC that evening, I circled the block three times until I found it. The entrance is nestled between other businesses with a glass door and on the entrance on a piece of white computer paper and magic marker was the word HOTEL. I thought to myself, okay this doesn't look so good to me. Well we all walked down this skimpy dingy hall to a desk where there was a woman waiting. I gave her my name and she told me sign here. I said to her that I wanted to check the room out. She said to get the key I had to sign. Well we started to walk up the stairs and she said no...no... go the elevator. We started to go into the elevator and when two of us got in and were staring face to face and the other people hadn't even gotten in yet, I said..nope guys...we walk. So we walked up three flights of steps to the so called suite. Upon walking through these dingy halls, there were people lurking about. When my son opened the door....I nearly fell over. There leaning against the wall were two mattresses. The sleeper sofa looked like it fell off of a garbage truck and the door separating the so called sofa sleeper and mattresses on the wall area from the beds, were shower doors. On the opposite side where the beds that look as if they came out of a dumpster were situated, were these mismatched junky bed spreads in this foul smelling room. I looked at the rest of my people and said NO WAY! I marched down to the steps and told the woman no way. She said no way? I said no...no way will we stay in this place. She said too bad, you booked room you must pay for one night. I said whatever....I am getting out of here. I did not feel safe at all. After I left I called and spoke to a man who said that "YOU PAY" we kept that room open for you all day. I truly doubt anyone would want that space. I asked him for my money back and he refused. I phoned Hotels and told them that they should know what kind of a place they are booking people into. I didnt even ASK for this place specifically by name, I just asked for a hotel in NYC. When I left there, we got two really nice quality rooms at the Milford Plaza Hotel and it cost less there for two rooms than the DUMP Manhattan Broadway. People should be aware of this place. It is absolutely the pits! Nothing you can even imagine. HORRIBLE!!!! I told Hotels about the situation and after they reviewed it with their supervisor they told me they could only give me back $70.00.
